Reviews.Title: “Affordable Boston!”
Reviews.Author: krazykatz03
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is obviously a little outdated, but who cares? Its clean, the staff VERY accommodating and the location for Boston is perfect and the hotel is AFFORDABLE for Boston. Its location is in walking distance to the theaters, T, and restaurants. You have parking available to leave your car. We always stay here for these reasons. Be realistic, you don't go to Boston to stay IN the hotel, only sleep and go out and enjoy the town.

Reviews.Title: “Best time”
Reviews.Author: totti45
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised on arrival at the Midtown (after reading some of the previous reviews we weren’t expecting much). All staff were extremely pleasant and helpful while booking in and for the duration of our stay. We had a problem with our return transfers (booked with the holiday) and the Concierge and Front Desk were so helpful. Our room was really spacious, comfortable beds and very clean, small bathroom with plenty of towels. We had no problem with noise, in or outside the hotel, we were at the front. The best thing about the Midtown is it’s location. It’s in Back Bay, which is a really nice neighbourhood, right opposite the Christian Science Centre (well worth a visit to the Mapparium), and two minutes from the Prudential Centre. Copley Square, Newbury Street and Boyslton Street with shops and eating places minutes away. There are a few T stations just up the road (really easy to use the underground) and the Old Town Trolley Bus stops opposite the Prudential Centre, useful for sightseeing and as transport. We were so tired by the evening so it was great to be near the Prudential Centre, where we normally ate but there are other places close. This hotel was excellent for us, it’s an affordable central hotel, a great base to explore Boston. We would definitely stay at this hotel if we were to visit Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location”
Reviews.Author: MarkA380
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great as a base for a city break, given the excellent location close to downtown Boston. The Symphony T-Stop is closest to the hotel, literally one minutes walk from the main hotel entrance. There is little to fault with this hotel, bearing in mind it is a budget hotel so therefore don't expect 5 star luxury! Despite it being budget, the rooms are massive and very clean, especially the bathroom. Towels were in plentiful supply, of good quality and were changed every day. The rooms also have large flatscreen LG TV's, with a huge range of channels and tea and coffee. The staff were very friendly throughout our stay and the only time we needed their help was with the wifi signal, which we learnt does struggle in rooms at the front of the building but the great view makes up for this! I would recommend this hotel to those who want an affordable, clean, well located, comfortable hotel which is perfect for exploring Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: michelle n
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for anyone who is travelling on a budget. The hotel was roughly $125.00 each night. The rooms were clean and spacious. The staff were very helpful. The hotel is close to the Prudential Center which is a more high end mall, however there is a Galleria Mall in Cambrige which is only a 10-15 cab ride. The TD Gardens is also about a 10 cab ride. There are severeal good food places in the area, including The Cheesecake Factory which has a wide menu to choose from and over 50 types of Cheesecakes for desserts. P.F Changs is also around the corner and has an excellent selection of food as well. Overall this hotel is great (if your high maintenance then you may not like this hotel as some of the furtniture and decor are a bit outdated- but who cares your in Boston and most likely wont be spending a lot of time in your room)

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: SophieZ118
Reviews.Content: The hotel is reaaaally well situated, just behind Prudential Center and with a T station just in front of it. Everything is here, soap, towels, beds, TV, etc. The rooms are really wide and you feel comfortable. BUT the walls are really thin, you basically hear EVERYTHING. I had a bad experience with a neighbor the last night and the woman at the front desk barely did something: "Yes, I'll see what I can do...", at 5am. They talked, yelled and f*** all night long and the hotel didn't do a thing! Plus, there's Berklee University near the place, so you can musicians all the time rehearsing next to your room until 2am. Anyway, the location is perfect, and this is all that mattered.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: lisagee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Midtown Hotel in Boston for a long weekend over the President's Day Holiday. We paid $99 a night for our room, we were touring Northeastern University and given this special rate when we made our reservation. Such a bargain! We arrived at 12 Noon and although check-in is not until 3 pm we were very happy to learn that our room was ready. Check-in was quick and pleasant and we were given a map to help us navigate the city. I was pleasantly surprised with our room. I did not have high expections given the price. The room was spacious and clean. Furnishings were a bit outdated but not a big deal. I felt perfectly safe in the hotel. No restaurant, room service or mints on our pillows - so what. Don't go to a hotel like this with expectations of The Four Seasons. We were quite pleased with the great location of the hotel. We felt that the fee for parking our car was very reasonable for a city. We left the laptop at home, we came to tour the city and the school so wifi was not a concern. No complaints from me. We really just slept and showered in our room. Our bed was very comfortable. I could see how some claustrophobic guests might be uncomfortalbe in the small bathroom. I will say that the hallway was rather loud in the morning, it was not an issue for us as we were up and out early, but if you want to sleep late this may not be the hotel for you. If you have reasonable expectations you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: Minidriver09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the midtown for 5 nights in February 2012. The hotel was very clean, the room was spacious with two double beds, plenty of floor space, big tv, table and chairs. Bathroom is a little small but has everything you need. The staff were all very helpful and gave great advice on things like restaurants. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but there are plenty close by. It's in a really good location very close to a metro station. Definitely a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Midtown - mid-rated”
Reviews.Author: AnotherGl0beTr0tter
Reviews.Content: Booked the Midtown in Boston through hotels tonight (nothing negative to say about the app - worked great!) and did not have a terrific experience (though didn't have a horrific one either). Arrived really really late, and even though I had called before to enquire if that woul dbe okay, they had no record of this at the front desk. The person doing the check in looked like he was annoyed I was checking in so late, and as a consequence was not the least bit friendly. While the room itself was not small, they crammed too much into it (two double beds) so it made it feel really tight. So while it was clean, it was not very comfortable in terms of moving around, and also the bed wasn't too comfy either. Location is good, parking is relatively cheap for the area, and wifi was good. Got a coupon for free parking and wifi through TripAdvisor, so that was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base”
Reviews.Author: Daisy0312
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Midtown Hotel for 10 nights in August 2011 and I would recommend it for those looking for a no frills, reasonably priced hotel in a central location. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable and spacious. The room had two double beds and we also hired a foldaway bed, however, the room was never cramped. One annoying thing was the bathroom had two sections with the sink only seperated from the room by a glass partition. So, at night if someone used the bathroom the light would wake everyone. The room is pretty basic but after a lot of research the Midtown appear to offer some of the best rates in Boston for such a great location. The Prudential Centre is less than a 2 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, super location”
Reviews.Author: Jo Sabel C
Reviews.Content: Clean, convenient, affordable--best location in Boston, set among the priciest hotels, yet way less expensive. Cheerful, friendly staff, too!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, Clean & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gentlewanderer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights here. Our room was a great home base while we enjoyed the city and went to see our son perform at the music conservatory. All the basics were there for us. No frills. But the staff was friendly and very accommodating. Because you are less than a block from the Symphony station on the T, it is easy to get to many places in the city using the subway. We had difficulty with wireless access to the internet. But thanks to TripAdvisor coupon special on this hotel page, we didn't pay for it. We could only get a decent connection in the lobby. But I would say that this was the only downside. Overall, a wonderful experience. We plan to stay there again, next time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic hotel living, Nice location to this area of boston, close to roadway and somewhat noisy”
Reviews.Author: Rich S
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent two days here. Rooms are clean and basic, beds are comfortable. You get no extras like room service. Internet is NOT free ($9.99/24hrs), parking is not included ($18/24hrs), no ice machines, only soda and candy machines. Parking is underground of hotel, however, if you own an SUV it may not fit...my sequoia touched the building and just squeezed in. All you get is a place to sleep. Don't stay in front of hotel as road and people noise from campus at northeastern is very noisy. Also, they have 24hr security guard so that concerned me if there's issues in the hotel. The location is great for train and walking in the area. I also felt the cost could be equal to staying at other/better hotels like Sheraton, Hilton so look into it. In summary, if you just need a place to sleep and don't mind some local noise this is a decent hotel. Overall, we had a good experience with this hotel but will shop/price compare better hotels in this area next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good exploration base”
Reviews.Author: Buksie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a four day stop over in Boston, and as others have noted, the location is truly very good. It is the closest non-overpriced hotel to the CBD. Public transport is conveniently close, shops, and with abit of walking the whole city is reachable. The service was not too welcoming but efficient, the rooms were clean, neat and what you would expect for the price. I'd say very reasonable for a almost budget stay-over. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: grt47
Reviews.Content: As we have stayed there a number of times over many years, we know the most desirable rooms and we keep coming back because of the location. The other major plus for Boston is the availability of parking right under the rooms. It used to be free, but it is still worth paying the additional charge. The facility is obviously in need of a major overhaul, there is only one slow elevator but it's still so convenient to haul your suitcase on a short distance without having to depend on an unpredictable Valet... Rooms definitely budget, no frills, no fridge, but most are quite large for Boston. Rated 4 stars (very good) because of the location and the cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, On-Site Parking, Decent Accomodationgs”
Reviews.Author: tepluken
Reviews.Content: The best reason to stay at this location is its incomparable location.It is within walking distance of the New England Conservatory, the Boston Symphony, the Prudential Center and Copley Square. Great cultural and culinary attractions, and ready access to the subway. The hotel itself was fine - quiet, clean, comfortable beds,hot water, ironing board. It does not have amenities such as an exercise room, a toiletry kit, or a continental breakfast. But it is perfectly fine as a quiet place sleep - a good value for the money One thing that my wife and I appreciated is that it has on-site parking for $18 a day. No need to rely on valet nonsense. And it is only five minutes from I-90 If you plan to visit Beantown - which everyone should - this is a place to say that is both convenient and economical

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: nancydHouston
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and serviceable property near two T stops in the fun neighborhood of Back Bay, central to Pru Center and Copley Square. Very fair room rates, clean, & with a responsive staff. Room definitely was budget but quite large. Disconcerting was the light for the bathroom lit both the bathroom behind a door, and the open- to- the- rest- of- the- room sink area, blazing the whole room with light during those late night excursions to the ladies room. Forced air heat is quite loud. All in all a very affordable spot. Tour buses stop right outside for boarding, so if you have a room on the Huntington side of the building, be sure those drapes are closed if you don't want to show yourself off to the folks on the double decker!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay”
Reviews.Author: MoisesRodrigues
Reviews.Content: Great localization with great bedrooms. I only had problems with the wifi coverage solved just by moving the table a little to the center of the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: AliMackBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: This mid-priced hotel was conveniently located near the Prudential Centre and Symphony Hall. The â€˜Tâ€™ was only steps away so that you could reach pretty much anywhere in central Boston easily. Although the hotel had a budget feel to it, the room we had was large and comfortable which was all we needed as we were out all day exploring the city. There was also parking available under the hotel â€“ a bonus in Boston where parking is extremely expensive. We had a voucher so we got free parking and Internet access. The staff were very helpful and were happy to store our luggage on our last day before we flew home. The hotel runs a shuttle to the airport during the day and will arrange taxi transfers if you are travelling at night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean and comfortable centrally located base in Boston. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: carole45
Reviews.Content: good location for underground and shops big rooms and very clean

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Location”
Reviews.Author: Corydoras
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. That's what the Midtown has going for it. Definitely worth checking out for parents with students at the schools along Huntington Ave. Right across the street from Symphony Hall and a block from Jordan Hall and BU/Huntington Theater. 2 blocks from the Pru. When we stayed, it wasn't cheap... but it was significantly cheapER than the other hotels in the immediate vicinity. It's very basic... kind of like a 1960's motel transplanted into the city. Skim the reviews and you'll find some complaints about cleanliness... our room and the corridors were clean, though dated and a bit institutional. AAA's two-diamond rating is quite accurate. The staff we met were extremely friendly and helpful. The parking was convenient. This hotel is not a destination. It's a place to sleep, for a few bucks less, while you do other things in the area. Worth your consideration if that's what you're looking for. We would certainly consider going back. But if you want an exercise room, places to hang out, lots of cable channels, luxury, onsite restaurant, or a view, check out the fancier places.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: no_444
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review for TripAdvisor before but a stay at The Midtown Hotel warrants a comment. I wont dwell on the little things like smelly corridors, dated furnishings, noisy springs in the bed etc.. I do however expect one basic thing of a hotel room... a door that actually locks. I asked twice for our room door to be fixed and let's just say, I'm still waiting for the tradesman to arrive. Upon my 2nd request, the night manager needed me to know they would not be held responsible for anything missing. I didn't need to hear this, I just needed some empathy and someone to fix the door!! On the positive side, it is in a very good location. It's a short walk to the train station and the Prudential Centre. The room was also a decent size & we found it quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: Bill L
Reviews.Content: There can only be two reasons for anyone to stay at the Midtown Hotel in Boston. One if you are affiliated with the Christian Science Church, it's directly across the street. The other reason is if you are unable to get any other hotel reservation in Boston. The hotel was charging the same as other major hotels during a meeting in Boston; it wasn't worth half of the rate they charged, and even at that anything other than basic services simply are not available. Give this place a pass.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JudyGrant
Reviews.Content: Physically this hotel is quite basic, but it has clean rooms, parking and a pool in summer. The location is truly great, we walked to everything or got the 'hop-on, hop-off' trolley. The staff at the Hotel are very well trained and are courteous and accommodating. The hall ways could do with an update, but I would still highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “New resting spot for the mext 4 years!”
Reviews.Author: mary P
Reviews.Content: Came to Boston in September when dropping my daughter off at Berklee College of Music. The location was perfect for us as it was a pretty walk thru the Christian Science Church complex and their beautiful reflecting pool. At first we were a little put off by the status of the hallways. But we left early one morning and by the time we got back our whole section looked brand new. The room was much bigger than I had expected, and being a bit of a germ freak was worried about the bathroom, but it was spotless (thank you Marie â€“ our housekeeper)! The staff was very friendly, including David, the maintenance man, who changed the light bulb in our room. We have found our resting spot for the next 4 years for our Berklee visits

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston base”
Reviews.Author: SomersetSimmo
Reviews.Content: I can only mirror whats already been said, fantastic location from which to explore Boston, not the most luxurious hotel, but clean, rooms are spacious and the service was good. Once the facelift and decorating is finished it will leave little to complain about - there was a very strange vending machine in one corridor from which you could get hot pizza - only in America!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for sampling Boston”
Reviews.Author: DCSouthport
Reviews.Content: The Midtown Hotel may not be the most luxurious in Boston, but its location makes it an ideal base for enjoying a city which can easily be explored on foot. My room was well appointed and allowed me three good nights' sleep. My only criticism was that you have to pay for internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID it it is terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: smartesthorse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a blot on classy Huntington Ave and the whole city of Boston. It is a low rise grubby looking place resembling the worst motel in Hicksville. The staff are rude and its DIRTY and smells.The bath was slick with someone else's bath oil. The fan in the bathroom that went on with the light was so noisy it was like a motor bike at full throttle so even had the bath been clean there was absolutely no chance of relaxing in there, I went to the loo in the dark!!! At night the corridors reverberate with the noise from similar fans. Then there is the wiring, I assume this place has a fire certificate but I don't know how. The floors have trailing extension leads with multi sockets, plugging in an adaptor led to lights going off and flashing. I have photos of the wiring and intend to take this further. I would have left immediately unfortunately I was booked with GREAT RAIL JOURNEYS who used to have reputation for good hotels, not anymore. I strongly advise anyone going with GRJ to Boston to insidt on a different hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Pam M
Reviews.Content: Great location and a clean, comfortable hotel with convenient on-site parking. The staff was friendly and helpful in all aspects of our stay including directions for sightseeing, referrals for restaurants and transporation to the airport. Bed was very comfortable. Compared to other hotels that we have stayed in, the TV was excellent! Our view of the The First Church of Christ, Scientist aka The Mother Church was outstanding. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Travelsphere This was a joke!!”
Reviews.Author: daddykool333
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel on our Travelsphere Holidays two week tour. The reception area was good ,but when you walked off to any other part of the hotel it was smelly and dire. Notices scattered around saying " sory for our decor" God it was rough! On entering our room the stench was unbearable, so went to reception and they gave us a room on another floor , yes this too was smelly but just bearable , The lights did not work and the coffee maker also malfunctioned, in fairness we had to stick it out ,at least the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. Travelsphere had us booked in here for three nights and all of the tour group were dismayed at this standard of hotel ,our tour manager likened it to a jaded motel . It would be an insult to any Motel I have stayed in! I hope you all find this usefull and happy travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: cerj2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during an overnight visit to colleges for my daughter. The location was fine and I liked having parking onsite. However, our first impressions of the hotel were not great. The night desk clerk who checked us in was professional but not very friendly. The hallways to the elevator are dark and narrow. If they were recently painted I couldn't tell. I would hate to see what they looked like before. The room was average. It was clean enough but looked dated and worn. The tub felt like it had a tub surround on it (like a bubble underneath) and had burn marks on the edge. The air conditioning fan is very loud, so much that when it goes off it wakes you up to complete silence or outside noise. The flat screen tv was very nice. The best part of the hotel is Ron the morning desk clerk! He was friendly and very helpful. He even printed us a map and gave us directions to the colleges. Without him I probably would have rated the hotel "poor" but, we left smiling because of him. If my daughter decides to go to college in Boston I will look around for a different hotel to try. I didn't feel that this one was worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update!”
Reviews.Author: godoit
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of the hotel were poor because the hallway was in a very poor state, then we found that the pillows were a few years past their best. There was no availability for breakfast, but we were glad to get out! The location was OK, but I'd recommend staying nearer Copely Square. We wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Short & sweet vacation”
Reviews.Author: elewisOttawa_On
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in Aug. 2011 for one night. We were in town to see a Red Sox game. The lobby area was nice with a gift shop near the entrance selling Boston souvenirs. The room is nice with a flat screen television. It was raining heavy and high winds ( Hurricane Irene ) when we there and the tv lost satellite reception. We called front desk about the problem and they sent someone who arrived within two minutes! He tried fixing it but you can't beat mother nature. We eventually got service back. The beds are comfy and the place is clean. The area around the hotel is 2nd to none. Wonderful neighborhood! If you have Red Sox tickets, parking is free for one night saving you $18.

Reviews.Title: “bad service, bad smell”
Reviews.Author: jim313
Reviews.Content: I went with my son to go to Fenway. room smelled like a sewer. people at the desk seemed put out to answer questions. accidently left soom clothes in room. called and got put on hold forever twice. emailed, no response. not cheap for low level motel style it is. avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly staff & nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blondethoughts
Reviews.Content: After our "issues" at the Berkeley the staff at the Midtown were very helpful & sorted us a room at the last minute. The room was very spacious, beds comfortable & the bathroom was clean. Little odd that the bath & toilet is separate to the sink but its not actually a problem. The location of the hotel is great - within walking distance to the shops, the centre & the freedom trail. Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel well situated”
Reviews.Author: neil r
Reviews.Content: Good sized, clean rooms. Friendly staff. The downside is it doesn't have a bar or relaxing lounge area. After a long day of sightseeing there is no where to relax. It would benefit from a bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great time had by all the family”
Reviews.Author: JohnSheridan102
Reviews.Content: I first booked the Mid-Town in October 2010 because of its accessibility to main shopping areas and central Boston while also offering access to two subway stations and regular bus routes on Mass-Ave. My wife was visiting our son at Harvard with her sister and mother. The choice proved to be perfect and all three were delighted as they felt the flexibility of travel choice gave them complete freedom to be independent to travel when, where and how they pleased and also be able to improvise easily with our son and his student friends. Bus,train,taxi, or foot, every-thing you need is literally 2 minutes away. Four of us (my wife and two teenage children) stayed again in August 2011. Again the staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. I have read many reviews on Mid-Town including some with derogatory remarks. What I would say to any dissenter is this: apart from hauling luggage to and from a room (for a family) who needs a lift in a two story building? The hallway carpets have been replaced. I have often been in hotels that say they have internet, have and then charge a fortune to use it! Its at the Mid Town and that's the main thing. The only critter I met during my stay was when we stayed over night in New York, (and that critter was on the street). There is a grand heated outdoor pool with towels provided. It is a great activity for those who wish to rest within the hotel during the day. The beds were very comfortable with clean white linen along with towels etc replaced by house keepers who were totally unobtrusive. Of course they knock on your door; and they have to start somewhere at 9.00 am; and there is a door jam/safety lock on your door plus a non disturb sign! We slept contentedly with no noise interference and perfect air con. Who in their right mind would bother wasting valuable city centre space on breakfast when you can have any choice of breakfast from around the world in the Prudential Centre exactly five minutes from bedroom to food service! There are also other excellent places even closer. I stood in a good quality N.Y hotel for breakfast where the self service left us with poor fruit juice,cold eggs, poor tea, paper plates and cups and then no place to sit! Next time any of you stay in a large Hotel just for fun time how long it takes from closing your door, traveling down a corridor, waiting for a lift, sharing it , making small talk, making your way to breakfast room, waiting for seat allocation.... get the picture? Mark kindly provided an extra bed so our student son could stay with us at night on a few occasions, and you know how cluttered a room can get with five plus suitcases laptops and different types of hand bags, shoulder bags, shopping bags, news papers, city maps, excursion maps , fliers etc! The house keepers somehow managed to do their job yet never move or interfere with anything other than what was in the bins. Safe keeping is discreetly provided at front desk. The staff mind their own business until approached and then were most courteous and helpful. Special mention for Kevin, Cornelius and Mark. In a rush to meet some friends who were just able to squeeze in time for a meal half an hour away and burning time trying to hail a taxi, Mark caught sight of the situation and walked out unto Huntington Ave, stopped a taxi and literally saved our evening! On our departure I asked Mark what I needed to do on tipping and his beaming retort was there was no need other than the staff to do their job which they enjoyed. I will never forget that one. Then poor Cornelius brought down our five suitcases and bags to rest room and subsequently to taxi and when I tipped him he insisted I take back half nor did he take no for an answer. Good luck to the Mid Town; Excellent value for its location unless you're called Cleopatra. Previously stayed in Hyatt Regency Cambridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Simple but enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ballagher
Reviews.Content: This 2 storey hotel made us a bit nervous at first as it is old and in need of modernization. The hallways resemble college dorms and it has an apartment feel to it. Our room was a bit musty but very clean. Once we got over the initial "this isn 't a chain hotel" we actually found it quite charming and appreciated it for what it was - a simple, clean, safe, no frills place to stay in a great part of Boston. Staff was great. Pool was well maintained. Too bad wifi was not free. Walking distance to so many places and subway nearby. Really enjoyed our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: hotslingers
Reviews.Content: The Midtown Hotel was a great affordable place for our family to stay on our sightseeing trip to Boston. For a older hotel, the rooms were clean with plenty of room and the hotel was right across the street from the Prudential Center/Mall, T Station and plenty of places to eat. They had a nice conceirge that gave us helpful directions and tips and all the staff was friendly. I recommend the Midtown to any family touring old town Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Thiago_Rio
Reviews.Content: Room was a bit old but okay. Staff was appropriate. Best part was location, close both to the city center and the Prudential Center.

Reviews.Title: “A fine stay”
Reviews.Author: cjp2
Reviews.Content: The Midtown is by no means an overly fancy hotel, in fact, it looks pretty outdated inside and out. However, for the most part, the accommodations were fine. I stayed here for a conference at Northeastern and it was very convenient to both the university, subway (green and orange lines within a few blocks), and commuter rail. There are a bunch of good restaurants and pubs close by, and chain restaurants and shopping are also within a few blocks). I would probably stay there again for a reduced conference rate. I don't know that I would pay full price to stay there. I didn't go in the pool, but it looked nice and there were plenty of others using it. I was greeted by a roach in the bathroom one morning, but colleagues who also stayed here did not have any issues with critters.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel/motel”
Reviews.Author: Johnbi1
Reviews.Content: I got this place on a last minute deal For two nights Boston at the end of a long road trip. It looks more like a motel than a hotel from the outside but once inside it's a nice little place. The room was big and clean, yes I agree could do with some updating in places but it was all fine for me, everything worked. The staff were extremely helpful and they had a parking garage for a decent price, rare in the city. A great location near a lot of places or witin walking distance plus the T stop right up the street very handy. My biggest complaint was the wireless and Internet. They charge $10 per 24hours, for hotel in this day an age this is extremely poor, even the $60 motel I stayed in on my trip had free wireless. Plus it is possibly the worst Internet ever, the connection could remain for more than 3mins without needing to reconnect and then very 10mins or so needing the password reentering. In the end I gave up, luckily I wasn't on business and needed the internet. A small thing but could be so easily solved. On the whole a nice little hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to city and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mitziB
Reviews.Content: Hotel very convenient. Easy access to Tourist Trolley car which is excellent for getting around the city especially on a short stay and if you want to see the city. Staff were very helpful especially the concierge who was from Kerry in Ireland - a lovely gentleman and very helpful. Initially we thought the car parking charge of $18 per night was a little steep but apparently this is normal if not better than most othe local hotels (according to the staff!) The only negative about this hotel (and it is not a major issue) is that the carpet running through foyer/hallways needs to be changed (badly) This hotel was perfect for our short term stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: Passepartout56
Reviews.Content: A slightly tired hotel decor wise but in a perfect location for sightseeing in Boston. Very friendly, helpful staff. Would definitely use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tinatang0
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. did the job. Centre of the city. Rates reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “We ended up having a great time”
Reviews.Author: ybreptilian
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel. Some of the reviews say "old and dirty" but this was not our experience at all. We had a clean room that felt kind of spacious. Great location, friendly staff, close to the train, supermarket near by. We had a great time. One glitch was that when I asked the front desk person at check-in where the elevator was, she was clueless! There is NO free internet... bummer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Back Home
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Midtown Hotel while attending a conference at Northeastern University, and wanted to be within walking distance of the university. The rates are very reasonable and the room was basic, but spacious and comfortable. (I had a room on the street side of the hotel; rooms on the inner side were smaller). If you require luxury bedding, name-brand toiletries, room service and a fancy lobby, you won't be happy at the Midtown. But if like me you need only a clean and comfortable room for sleeping and showering, and spend most of your travel hours out and about, then this hotel might fit the bill. Reservation was made months in advance and there were no glitches. Desk staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Great location, just a couple of blocks across from Prudential Center if you need a high-end mall fix, and a short walk to many restaurants, coffee shops and pubs if you want local fare. Close to boutique shopping on Newbury Street. Bus stop and the Symphony T station are a few steps from the hotel door, so you can go all over the city for a few dollars. I'll definitely try the Midtown again on my next trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “We found the hotel "proper job"”
Reviews.Author: RontheJanner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights. We found the Hotel Ok. Rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Agree that passageways are a bit of a maze but soon found the best way from reception to room. Also a bit odd that the washbasin is ouitside the bathroom. Chambermaid services very good. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location of the hotel is good for getting to points of interest in Boston. . Good value considering Boston hotel prices..Our second stay in the Hotel and would use it again. We booked direct withthe hotel on line and service was very good

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: DebbieW1042
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our hotel in Boston, the Midtown Hotel. The location was great; very clean rooms; and friendly staff. Restaurants close by and most of the tours would pick us up at our hotel. We would stay there again. Hint: We took the subway from Logan Airport to hotel. Took the courtesy bus to blue line subway to State street. At State we changed to orange line and got off at Mass Ave. Midtwon to left a block. Cost four or five dollars as compared to taxi thirty something one way! Subway nice and easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean enough”
Reviews.Author: briabeaude
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Midtown hotel twice now. The best thing about the hotel is safe parking and the location between downtown and Fenway Park. Parking is around $18 unless you have a ticket to the Red Sox game, then it's free for the day. Both Fenway Park and downtown are within walking distance and there is a subway station right next to the hotel (don't worry, it doesn't cause any noise). I'll likely stay here again. The only bad thing is it's tough to find a deal for this place so it'll usually be close to $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: lpinion2
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel for the price. At about $200 per night, this was a steal compared to other hotel rates in the area. The hotel is older than some of the others, and rooms are standard, but the location is great! It is a block from Prudential Center, which has great shopping, food and metro access. Also a children's fountain and reflecting pool across the street. Using the metro from this location was incredibly easy, even for those with little or no experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-nil else”
Reviews.Author: Warwickgirl06
Reviews.Content: First time in Boston with my daughter. First time driving on the wrong side of the road in an automatic car so my arrival at the hotel via a satnav was very frought. It did not help that our booking was done via Virgin and was done in 2 stages-4 nights broken up into 1 and 3 nights. As a result they did not realise even though I had sent an email before I had left. Our room for nights 2-4 were held for someone else. We were told to sort it on our first morning- no-one knew anything about it. Explanations all over again. Good for Fenway Park and Sarah's first baseball match. Free parking which saved us $18 by providing your ticket. Room was old, and overlooked the underground garage. Could be quite noisy as we were on the corner of a busy thoroughfare next to the drinks machine. Steps down to the garage and up to our room-don't bring heavy suitcases! Shaw has a great supermarket just up the road with the Cheesecake Factory nearby. Died and went to heaven. Great location for everything, Metro was easy,walked everywhere. Left the car in the garage for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “nothing fancy but great location”
Reviews.Author: StaKat
Reviews.Content: Midtown is in a great location, close to Newbury Street, close to the T, across the street from the Prudential Center. Hotel staff, especially Ron, is very nice and helpful. Ron went out of his way to help us and suggest places to go. Hotel is older and nothing fancy but bed was comfortable and room was very large. Sink is outside the bathroom which was kind of strange. Area where shower and toilet are is a bit small. Went to Fenway Park for the game - walked, kind of a hike but it was a nice night so it wasn't bad. Compared to other hotels I checked, Midtown is a good price, considering the great location.

Reviews.Title: “This place made ghetto motels look beautiful”
Reviews.Author: IbnBattutaofBoston
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience I have ever suffered. If I had a second chance I would have slept in my car. As soon as we arrived in the hotel for pricing two rooms, the staff who desperately needed some coffee, rudely told my friends and I that they could only supply us with wireless internet if we booked our two rooms. He implied that we were going to use the net to run out the door and book another hotel. That was real cheesy, but it got worse. After hearing a outrageous price for two rooms, we booked because it was late at night and we were all tired. Now that we had paid the staff over $250 not including the cost of parking we thought we could now use the internet. However that was not to be. The staff told us we had to pay for the wireless with a credit card or use the archaic computer in the corner of the lobby with a credit card slot! When we attempted to travel two our rooms we found that the staff had placed our two rooms at opposite sides of the hotel, ie. a 10 minute walk down a rabbit warren of hallways that a room cleaner told us some people never make it out of. As my buddy and I entered our room we where pleasantly surprised to find that our lights did not work in our Russian gulag looking room. After another ten minute hike down the suicide inducing hallways we found that out other buddy's room was around twice the size and with more than 6 TV channels as featured in our own room that we had paid the same price for. Go figure. Going back to the light issue, we found that in order for our lights to work, the main room switch had to be in the off position and the table lights bulbs were blown. One actually nice feature about this hotel was that the rooms showers do not have coin slots as I was convinced they must have. In the morning we had to wait behind a gentlemen who was complaining that his "paid for" ten minutes of wireless time was not connecting. Do you think he was refunded? I will let you decide that for yourself. In a nut shell, when visiting this hotel I would just carry a picket sign with my credit card numbers written on to save myself some time and pain. A safe bet would be to book a hotel other then this one. I for one found the quality of this hotel hard to stand with disgruntled employees that I do not blame for their stress and boredom. If you want the Guantanamo Bay experience, this is just the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: suzyq58
Reviews.Content: hey there, stayed at the midtown hotel. its an older hotel, that could use some updating. the rooms are a decent size, an it can be a little noisey with traffic, but you cant beat the location. right in the heart of great shopping, fantastic restaurants, copley, the pru,within walking distance to fenway,if you are going to symphony hall, cross the street an you are home. you could stay at the other more expensive hotels near by, but why would you, when you can stay here, an have money left over to do something. and the staff is friendly and helpful, another big plus in boston

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay..everything I expected and more”
Reviews.Author: SweetSerenitea
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to go into Boston for the weekend to celebrate our anniversary and wanted to stay somewhere where we could easily access everything we wanted to do and I must say this hotel is in the perfect location. We were able to walk down the street to get something to eat and could easily access the subway. The hotel room was comfortable and clean. There were many T.V channel options. I actually somehow managed to forget my toothbrush and I went to the front desk and they gave a new one for free! They are very accomadating and polite. I would definitely stay there again. The price is right and you get great service. I slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, would stay again, Fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: adapaoferidu
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the midtown many times & will stay there again. Good, large rooms with comfortable beds & quite. Yeah it's a bit dated but it's 2 blocks from Copley square! Parking is extra but a reasonable rate for downtown Boston. Wifi is also extra.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: humpday
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't expensive (for Boston standards), but you get what you pay for. My room had several burn marks from the hotel iron (I guess that person didn't like the ironing board). The walls are super thin as I could hear my neighbors' conversations, urination in the toilet, television, etc. I ended up waking up every hour or so in the middle of the night because whenever the heater turned on, it literally sounded as if someone was trying to break through my door (the heater is placed near the doorway). If you're in Boston for a day or two (no more than that), and you don't need to relax or get lots of sleep, then this hotel will work just fine. I don't recommend this place for vacation or relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: TexasEXtraveler
Reviews.Content: Where to start with an opinion of the Midtown Hotel? Well, the room rate was excellent and the location convenient for the stay required. Newbury Street, the Purdential Building, Boston Symphony, and subway station are all within walking distance. A subway Aside from this the experience was less than stellar. The parking, while available is limited. The hotelâ€™s dÃ©cor is dated. The carpet looks old and dirty to the point we elected not to walk in bare feet. The first morning there, a family member awoke to find a large roach stuck under their suitcase. This did not reinforce our comfort level with the hotel. Well not unexpected, the street noise is really bad. If people on the sidewalk stopped or were talking on the phone outside our room window their conversations were completely audible. Sirens throughout the night felt and sounded as though they would come right through the room. At one point a family member paid $2.00 for a bottle soda from a vending machine. They stated it tasted poorly, and alas the expiration date had come and gone. A computer in the lobby requires a credit card and WiFi is a charge, too. If one is looking for inexpensive, convenient accomodations in Boston the Midtown might work. If comfort, cleanliness and sleep quality are important perhaps pay more and expect more.

Reviews.Title: “BEST value for your buck in Boston”
Reviews.Author: yellie2984
Reviews.Content: What a value! We chose to stay here for the price and location when we went to a concert in Boston. I got a lot more than I expected for the price. Staff was welcoming the minute we walked thru the door. Our room was "clean!" I am that person who looks for the unknown hair on the floor or dirty (skeevy) blankets and I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness. The cleanliness is the reason for this review, staff would be second, and you can't beat the location! I will most definately recommend to everyone I know that is looking for clean, convenient, welcoming hotel this is it...the best bang for your buck in Boston!!! Thank you Mark at the front dest - you were wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money-but beware large groups staying”
Reviews.Author: mrsgregg
Reviews.Content: I was aware of the comments previously written about this hotel, but can honestly say that the hotel is clean, rooms are spacious and the hotel was handy for the subway. The desk staff are pleasant as are the housekeeping staff. We had booked for 11 nights and the first 7 were uneventfull, however on the 8th night we were kept awake till 3am by the room above us. My husband complained to the front desk and the noise did go down a little, and eventually at 5:30 it stopped. There were 3 groups booked into the hotel that day, one of them being high school kids who come to Boston for Uni visits. The next night was slightly better but the layout of the hotel is over 2 floors and there was an exit door at the end of the corridor which can be accessed 24 hrs, meaning that guests can come in this door without going past the front desk- resulting in many young people going past your room at all hours-noisy. I spoke with the manager on the second morning asking if the group leaders could remind their groups that other guests were staying in the hotel, and he informed me that the group was checking out that day- hurrah. However when we arrived back that evening another group of kids were checking in- my husband spoke to a very understanding girl at the desk, who said that this group were in rooms all over the hotel, but she could move us to another room at the back of the hotel which would be quieter. We then had the last 2 nights in peace. So I would recommend that if you intend to stay here in March/ April- ask for a quiet room. Apart from this one incident I would recommend thhis hotel.

Reviews.Title: “''Great place in Boston''”
Reviews.Author: chrusto
Reviews.Content: I've been at this hotel year ago in with my husband for one week.The room was very clean,large and bed very comfortable.The staff was very friendly too.The location was good for this price.Next year i plan to go Boston,so will stay the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Helpful & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: carriemill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely no frills and somewhat dated in it's decor but it is very clean and very close to shopping, dining and transportation. The staff is so very helpful and dedicated to seeing to the needs of guests. The price is very reasonable for the area also. Parking is available also. Staying at this property was an overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been better off at a La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: adamflux
Reviews.Content: It's the service that will strike you first of all. When we arrived, my colleague had already arranged for a roll out bed for the floor, and the desk clerk explained that this would cost extra, despite that we had already ordered it. The price calculation it gives you does not take this into account. Nor does it take into account their outrageous parking fee. But that opens another matter I'll come back to in a moment, a coercive ugly matter. The room was tenable upon first inspection, nothing fancy but nothing horribly shabby either. Frankly it seems like the majority of the budget was spent on the LCD television. The internet access is for pay, and by the way, it's not wifi, so I hope you roll around with cat5 cables in your luggage or you'll have to wait until you can walk down to the Panera. The security was decent despite our view of the brazen graffiti from our window, and we never had any fear of the cleaning staff stealing our possessions. This was largely because the cleaning staff was remiss in their duties to begin with. We came back one evening to find the room smelling of mildew and only one of the beds made. I'm still puzzling over why they would bother to make just the one bed and leave the other. The desk staff again was curt and practically useless, there was a gentleman at the tourism desk who gave me the phone numbers I'd need to call for pizza but if you should ring the service desk by mistake or simply have an inquiry be prepared for a conversation with a rude clerk. Finally, I want to discuss the parking fee policy, which is the most shady piece of rubbish I've ever seen in a hotel, keeping in mind that I've traveled in four continents and stayed at dozens of hotels on all ends of the price scale. Shadiest practice EVER: You must pay a fee (I believe it's 15-18$ each night) in order to park your car in their cramped garage in which exit signs direct you to dead ends. HOWEVER, you can escape this fee, if you should check into the hotel using foursquare. That's right, give them free viral marketing or pay them a fee. Outrageous. I've been at many establishments that ask for customers to use internet apps of this kind to add to their publicity but never have I had such a rat hole demand this in return for not charging me a hidden fee. If you want me to tweet or facebook or foursquare your hotel you need to step up your service, not charge me more hidden fees. This is a hotel to be avoided, the extra cash you spend to stay at something with an extra star is worth it this time.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here is you're desperate”
Reviews.Author: jls74
Reviews.Content: This hotel was gross. It looked like it had not been updated since the series finale of The Brady Bunch. Bed was terribly uncomfortable with awful bedding. Cigaratte burns? Really? Very thin walls, very noisy place. Busses outside left running. Fumes. Ick. Very uncomfortable and I'll never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a little bit old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: april_79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during March for a couple of days while visiting Boston. The hotel is good, it seems that it might have been a very good business hotel like 20 years ago, but now the place looks as if we were in 1980. Good things: the rooms are quite large, they beds are comfortable, they provide complimentary coffee and tea maker and it is 1 block away from the subway. Bad things: they do not have wi-fi, they charge you if you want to use the hotel PC located in the lobby, the bed covers are a little bit dirty and ours had cigarette burns, there is only 1 elevator located in the exact opposite corner of our room and to get to the elevator from the lobby you have to climb stairs (which is complicated when you have a lot of luggage as we did) Even when we had a good time, and our stay was pleasant, I think that you might be able to find a nicier hotel for the price they charge for the room

Reviews.Title: “Price and location make up for thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: SuiteLover
Reviews.Content: We were staying here because of a convention. The convention center is an easy one block walk, even in the winter. The Prudential Center which houses the convention center also has a plethora of dining options. There is even a full grocery store that is 24hrs. Laundry and a little diner and convenience store and even closer. If you exit via a side door, you are steps from the Symphony T stop. We paid $67 a night which is about what this hotel is worth when you add in the minifridge for $5 a night and the wifi for $6.50 a night. There is no breakfast. Parking is $18 a day. Pros beyond location and price are that the front desk is always staffed and very good, housekeeping is very quick, usually done by 2 PM, and wifi is pretty fast - we got 10 MBPS and could stream netflix. Cons - very thin walls which when the school kid trip came to town was really annoying. A lot of the vending machines were broken. The furniture, bathrooms, and decor were very dated. The heater is very noisy, as many have noted. We took to turning it on while we were gone then turning it off at night. The TV would have really weird static bursts on several channels making them nearly unwatchable. If you need to be at the convention center and don't want to pay $200 a night, then by all means, use this hotel. But, scale your expectations down accordingly. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “questionable neighbors”
Reviews.Author: slozinski
Reviews.Content: The location is oK, the staff was all very friendly. We went with our daughter to scout colleges in Boston after a long day on campus tours we went to bed at about 11pm at about midnight it started . We had prostitutes next door. Unbelievably loud. We heard them arguing for 1/2 an hour then the bed going for half an hour etc...... There is no way the staff could not have noticed a parade of people coming through at this hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DK28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Midtown hotel for 5 nights this previous week, I must say that I was attracted by its location as much as anything. On arrival I was greeted by a very friendly concierge who offer to assist me with my baggage upon arrival. Check in was quick and easy and I was directed to my room down the hall. Some people may be put off by the long corridors, to me it was not bothersome. I arrived in my room to find it very clean, spacious and well equipped for my stay. With a 32 inch HD tv to compliment the room I felt right at home. There is ample room to hang clothes and store them in drawers which I found very useful. The room had a fantastic view of the Prudential center and Huntington Ave. All in all I was very impressed with the room. The staff at the midtown were simply AMAZING! I had a minor issue in my room one morning and within 30 minutes it had been sorted, I must say Ron who works on the front desk is a rock star, he and all the staff made my stay simply fantastic, so help with everything, from finding places to eat, to advice on what to see and to organising my travel back to Logan Airport, it was all made so simple for me! I will certainly be returning to the midtown in the future, thank u guys! The staff at the

Reviews.Title: “What is that smell??”
Reviews.Author: jellybean1956
Reviews.Content: Great location, parking included in covered area. Those are the two good points. The room itself was most unpleasant. After about 30 seconds, the inside lining of my nostrils started to tingle and then just plain felt sore and stinging. It's a day later, I'm at home and my nose is still bleeding somewhat. I am not someone who is usually sensitive to these things so I have to conclude that their choice of product(s) for the purpose of cleaning the room is some concoction of industrial strength toxic detergents that would probably prove cancerous if exposed to it everyday for "x" amount of time!!!!! Truly distressing. One note here: the bathroom appeared very clean. I put a plastic wrapper from a plastic glass they provide you over the tv remote and I immediately removed the polyester bedspread. Eeewww. Sheets and towels seemed clean, bright white and soft. As other people have posted, charged for internet connection. We had just returned from a third world country and even hotels there provided free connection! Really. How do they justify this cost? Our signal was okay but we only paid for it once for two hours. Plumbing noise is a very big problem for those who are looking to sleep at this hotel. You can hear adjacent room occupants shower, use the sink and flush the toilet as well as their conversations. And they weren't yelling; it's just flimsy walls. And because people are coming and going at all hours (I'd ask in advance if neighbors are getting up for an early flight so you can be far away from the noise!) it's a foregone conclusion you'll be awakened during the night at least once. And let me not forget to mention the slamming doors!!!! Walls are like paper and doors sound like prison doors in the wee hours. If you use the elevators, don't look closely. It's gotta be 20 years since anyone ever cleaned the insides. Most likely a petri dish for many nasty germs and bugs. Take the stairs if filth bothers you. (The stairwell was surprisingly freshly painted and carpeted?) Staff was fine but then again, they know the score. "It's cheap. What can you expect?"

Reviews.Title: “Great for a fun night in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: hoopsters0012
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a great time at the Midtown. It was the perfect location for a girl's night out. the staff were all great and I would recommend them to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: foxxfyre
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here the weekend of the Pats-Jets game. Great locations - right by the Prudential Centre and its subway stop (which takes you directly to the Boston Common, and the start of the Freedom Trail) and the Back Bay Station (which we used to take the Patriots Train to Gillette Stadium). Lots of restaurant, pubs and the college-age crowd. Rooms were HUGE with lots of drawer space. Some people have commented on the odd bathroom design (the sink is outside of the bathroom) but I personally found it handy to have access to the sink while my friend was showering. Staff was professional and courteous. I did not use the internet at all while there so I have no comments about it. It was easy to get to the hotel and to exit Boston (we were driving). My only complaint are the thin walls! You can hear everything in the other rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny and then some!”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastBound37
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat skeptical about staying in this hotel, especially after reading some of the reviews here..but $89 a night in its location? I couldn't beat it anywhere. So I gave it a shot, and was pleasantly surprised. We arrived and parked in the convenient garage below the hotel and went to check in. I guess it is normally $18 dollars a night to park but if you are going to a sporting event (we were going to see the Bruins) the parking is free. We reserved a standard king on the first floor with a street view, and were quickly checked in by the front desk staff who were beyond nice. We went up to our room and were very skeptical at this point, the hallways were long and confusing, and very poorly lit. So we made it to our room and we were very impressed! The rooms must have had an overhaul because a lot of people said the furniture and decor was out dated..not so much in our room. It was a very large room with a nice table with chairs, modern looking lamps and a 32" HDTV! With options to order a movie. So DONT pay attention to the older photos in this review..it was a very nice room. The bathroom was very small but very clean..I mean come on, its not like we are going to be sleeping in there! The bed was freshly made and very comfortable. When we went to sleep that night, the heater was a little loud, but nothing unbearable..and we didnt hear ANY traffic regardless of the fact the street was right out of our window..so we had a VERY comfortable sleep. The staff is amazing. The next day, we went to go have breakfast, and we got some very generous discount coupons from a restaurant place down the street owned by their sister hotel (The Clonnade). The concierge offered me a complimentary paper for my breakfast and told me to enjoy my meal..he was so very nice. We came back, got ready to go out and watch the Patriots at a local bar and the concierge stepped outside and grabbed a cab for us! He was always available and made our stay even more impressionable. There was a 10 dollar charge for 24 hour WiFi access which is a little unheard of these days..but I was on a trip to enjoy time with my fiancÃ©e..not cruise the internet. You cant beat the location of this hotel..it is RIGHT NEXT to the Symphony T stop..its not in between the two, the building is just so long it takes 2 minutes to walk from the lobby doors to the entrance to the T...you could not get any more convenient. We went to the Bruins game and the front desk staff gave us some menu options for late night dining, and we took full advantage. We checked out the next day with no problems. So yes, the hallways need more lighting and the outside looks dated. But WHO CARES? We paid half of what someone across the street at the Sheraton paid and still got the 5 star treatment from staff members and thats whats most important. We weren't treated like tourists on a budget..we were treated like real people. So are there on site amenities? No..but walk 5 minutes and use a coupon the hotel gives you. Its worth it. Is there a charge for parking? yes..but significantly cheaper than any hotel and FREE if you show them a sporting event ticket. Clean rooms, HDTVs, friendly staff, absolutely convenient location, reasonable room rates. This place had it all in my opinion. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The midtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stltobos44
Reviews.Content: The midtown is great for any event that is in boston. It is right in the middle of everything and has a very close t stop. The room was great and had everything that could possible be needed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place, Location, service”
Reviews.Author: FloridaKtalina
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the convention center, the symphony station, and the service is fantastic. It is not a 5 star hotel and quite honestly is a bit on the outdated stage but it is very clean and welcoming. All of the employees greeted us everyday and tried to help any way they could. My only concern is the wireless internet. If you need wireless internet make sure you are room is located right on top of the lobby. Our room was way down to the left of the hotel and we had issues with it. Having said that, after we informed the people at the front desk they took the fee out of our bill. Great hotel and the location is just PERFECT!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: brownlab77
Reviews.Content: The Midtown is pretty much right in the center of everything in Boston. You're close to attractions, shopping, food, clubs, Sox games... Plus they allow pets which is great because I can bring my lab with me when I am visiting friends in the city. If you want to be pampered, then book one of the boutique hotels. If you want an affordable, comfortable place to stay while you are out and about having fun and exploring Boston, then the Midtown is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Seattlefan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within a block of the Symphony T stop so it was a great location for pulblic transportation. They upgraded my room the first night I got there which was great because I was there for a week. The only problem was that I was directly across from the parking garage and could hear beeping constantly. I had the heater on to drown out the noise but then my room was just hot. The heater was pretty noisy too,

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: hkimsurg
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during a convention for 3 nights for $250 dollars a night !!. The hotel is old more like a rundown motel . The heating would not work during the night, one morning the water would not get hot for shower. I asked the desk and the response was, the pipes are old and takes time to heat the water!!!. I was in te shower for about 15 minutes and basically temp did not change, so took a cold shower. The WIFI , whch they charge 10 dollars a night!!. did not work . After spending 30 minutes trying to log on. I asked the desk and their answer was, that part of the building probably has very weak signals!!!. They tried to charge me during check out !!. I would have not gone there if there was another options. I 'd rather stay outside the midtown and pay for taxi next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to say ..”
Reviews.Author: Mimi76Bolbec_France
Reviews.Content: this is a no frills hotel .. watch out you might get lost in the maze .. had to pay for wi fi $ 9.95 per connection !! unbelievable !! but staff was nice ... not much to say ... parking is $ 22 per night .. room was roomy but flushing toilets from other rooms kind of loud ..

Reviews.Title: “Wow. When was the last time this place was renovated?”
Reviews.Author: eagvent
Reviews.Content: I expected old but I didn't expect this. There are flat screen TVs in the rooms but I don't think anything else has been touched in 20+ years. I had 3 rooms (246/220/204) over 2 nights. The initial room assigned had virtually no wireless signal, so I was moved closer to the lobby. That room had a marginal signal at best that dropped off frequently, so I moved again. With the last room very near the lobby, the signal was acceptable. While the Front Desk was perfectly gracious in making the changes, it's still a huge issue that they offer wireless but it's so ineffective in much of the building. I'm only giving it 2 stars for cleanliness but this is more a reflection of the room being old and shabby, not necessarily dirty. White socks worn around the room weren't black on the soles, so the rugs looked terrible but weren't actually dirty. The thermostat did work for temp control but the fan went from "off" to "jet engine" with nothing in between. The room did not have any fridge, nor did it have any convenient outlets for my laptop or phone charger. I moved the table around to make a suitably powered desk.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location with great value”
Reviews.Author: CMLinDaytonaBeach
Reviews.Content: The Midtown is centrally located and was a great value. A clean hotel with all the necessities. The staff was beyond helpful and we felt safe and secure. Flat screen TVs, hairdryers, etc whatever you needed. Close to everything - the Subway, trolly cars, shopping, Prudential Building with shopping...close enough to walk to sights in Back Bay. I would definitely go back to the Midtown!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel with good service and cost”
Reviews.Author: msk60750
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent - could walk to the museums - on trolley line, public transportation. Rather basic hotel, but had great concierge service. Helpful, friendly, knowledgable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would avoid this old worn out motel from the 60's”
Reviews.Author: db3708
Reviews.Content: This is a 2 story old building, lobby looks like 1960. The halls are dark and dreary, really is a typical motel of that era. In our first room there was no wifi signal. After awhile we realized that water was dripping from an old ceiling air conditioning unit onto the desk and carpet. We asked for another room and next were shown a handicapped room with a broken noisy air conditioner. The third room also had a broken noisy air conditioner . Finally we accepted a fourth room. Here the wifi (10$ per night) worked but would allow only 1 computer. We selected the hotel because of the location and the fact that is was relatively inexpensive. Well as usual you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “2 star was advertised, 2 star we got”
Reviews.Author: Karendude
Reviews.Content: When all the other hotels were over $300 on a Saturday night, we found this place on Travelocity's "secret" hotels. .....two star in Back Bay was worth the gamble. We thought it was nice for the money, the 1950's decor was kind of funky. The room has lots of space and was clean. No frills.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Even Greater Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPirates
Reviews.Content: We moved from a Cambridge hotel on the Lechmere T when we discovered that this hotel appeared to have a great combination of value (even less that the outlying Cambridge hotel) and location. It is a short block & half walk to the T at the Prudential Center (Green Line). We thought it would be best to call the hotel since we were moving on Saturday morning, but the telephone reservationist said there was no room, even though the online system showed availability. No matter, we booked the room online, arrived relatively early (11am) and there was a very satisfactory room available for us. The pool was out of service but the hotel had an arrangement with The Collonade hotel (a bolock and half away, right at the Prudential T) so we could use The Collonade's very fine rooftop pool. (I believe the Midtown & the Collonade may be "sister" hotels with the same parent company.) We had been concerned that we would not be able to stay in a decent Boston hotel at a good price. The Midtown Hotel proved our assumptions wrong and has apparently been doing so successfully for many years. We will stay here (or the Collonade!) on our next trip to Beantown.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet & convenient”
Reviews.Author: lkadlec
Reviews.Content: It is true that the Midtown is pretty no-frills - no restaurant, no fitness center, etc. However, if you want an affordable hotel in a convenient location, it's pretty hard to beat. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet (as well as a pretty good size). The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is located about midway between the Symphony and Prudential T stops on the Green Line. The shops and restaurants at the Prudential Center mall are a short walk away, as are a number of stores and restaurants on Massachusetts Avenue. Pretty much any Boston attraction you want to visit is easily accessible by public transportation, which is really easy to get to from the hotel. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: JM56044
Reviews.Content: I booked the Midtown knowing it was a middle range hotel but inspired by good reviews on Trip Adviser. The reviews were right. The decor is a bit tired and seen better days but that is more than made up for by the great central location, really good sized rooms and helpful staff. My wife and I asked when booking to be in a room near my son and daughter who also booked. After a disappointing hotel in New York which ignored all booking requests, it was a delight to arrive at the Midtown and all our requests met with no fuss. Indeed, they found us adjoining and linked rooms staff. The excellent customer service made for a really enjoyable stay. Oh. And finding there was a swimming pool there during a Boston heat wave was a real bonus. Well done Midtown and thanks.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: b_catalina
Reviews.Content: Great location, good price, good rooms. I would definitely recommend it, especially if you, like most tourists, spend almost the whole day outside your hotel but still expect a spacy, clean, comfortable room waiting for you. Its just what me and me family wanted, nothing less, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: iwficon
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to spend your hotel time in Boston in the lap of luxury, then the Midtown is probably NOT the place to book into. That said, if you're looking for an affordable hotel in a good location then it's certainly not a bad place to stay. The rooms are tidy, if on the small side (but more than adequate for light travellers) but the bathroom was a let down. There was no door between the bedroom and the sink which meant that late night visits to the bathroom neccessitated turning on a light that shone brightly into the room (with the result that it wakes up your sleeping companion). And maybe it was bad luck in my particular room but there sure seemed to be an awful lot of noise from other people's showers pervading the early morning silence in our room. Yet the staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean. So if you're merely looking for a place to drop your bags and catch a couple of hours of sleep during a trip to Boston this offers a reasonably priced, decently located hotel (it was ideal for my excursions in Boston, including taking in a baseball game at Fenway Park). If you want a bit more than that, it's probably worth spending the extra money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, friendly & Central”
Reviews.Author: cullion6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Midtown hotel on 1st and 2nd June 2010. It is accurately described on these pages as being a'60's type motel but it is spotlessly clean, extremely friendly and all the staff we encountered were very helpful and forthcoming with information. Our bedroom was large and comfortable, there was two double beds in the room and for the price we paid we felt it was very good value. It is within walking distance of most main attractions, the Prudential building and Copley Square is literally a few minutes walk away. There is a trolley bus stop just up the street and tickets for the trolley bus are sold in the hotel. The only downsides to this hotel was the fact that there is no fridge in the room and the refuse disposal truck collected rubbish just under our window which was very noisy. Otherwise I'd have no problem recommending this hotel and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Three nights of living hell”
Reviews.Author: HonuVisitor
Reviews.Content: The location was ok with access to the subway. However, we could hear the tv's blaring in the other rooms, people playing drinking games, distinct conversations (complete with loud swearing) from other rooms, and when our neighbors took a shower the pipes rattled so loud I thought they would come out of the wall. It is dark and smelly. We couldn't sleep at all. Burn marks all over the carpet, the window latch was broken so it wouldn't close and the television was also broken, but the staff didn't care when we called about the problems. I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: lkis229
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due to its location near the Prudential Center and several T Stops. The rooms were no nonsense but both the room and bathroom were clean with plenty of closet space. The staff was friendly and helpful and the price of parking for each day was only $18, which is not bad for a city location. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no frills”
Reviews.Author: willgmac
Reviews.Content: Decent size room, everything worked fine Location for the hotel is excellent Property is a little old, but is being well maintained Hotel staff friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, convenient no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKChicken
Reviews.Content: Good location close to transport links and within easy walking distance of the dangerously wonderful Cheesecake Factory! The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were large and comfortable enough. Definitely not a luxury hotel, but fine for somewhere to sleep after exploring Boston. Our aircon didn't work, but we didn't bother making a fuss for our 1 night stay so can't say if it would have been fixed for us. Felt a bit like a student hostel. Perfect for a cheap (other than parking - $18 overnight) and cheerful short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok with 2 year old”
Reviews.Author: LordMunodi
Reviews.Content: We used to live in Boston and wanted to go back and visit with friends. We brought our 2 year old son with us and had a pleasant enough experience. They did not charge for the pack n' play crib - we were able to use the pool, located in the center of the building, but it was outdoors. It was very cold though! The rooms were a little run down, but basic - we spent most of our time out revisiting this city and just wanted a place to sleep/store our belongings. Our room faced Huntington Ave. - but it was really quiet - I've read the other reviews on how you could hear the other neighbors - maybe we just didn't have neighbors or just couldn't hear them?? The staff was friendly and we would go back. :)

Reviews.Title: “Stinky Worn Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HenryGuise
Reviews.Content: The first thing you notice when you enter your room is the stench of the cheapest Febreeze unsuccessfully used to hide the foul stench of molds. The towels are so old and worn that leave you feeling disgusted with yourself for having used them in the first place. Hallways and rooms aredark and gloomy. You have to pay $10 for Wi-Fi and the room had a very poor signal, so I couldn't use the Wi-Fi. They had DSL too, but I had no clue how to set up my laptop to use DSL.
