There is a strong humming noise at night that I couldn't figure out what it is, but had to sleep with earplugs. This hotel is cheap, located close to almost everything in Boston, and the staff are friendly, but its cheapness is completely not worth the bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Room Large, Price Good, Location Wise”
Reviews.Author: MissHK2009
Reviews.Content: This is the largest but cheapest room I have stayed in my USA east coast journey. Room very spacious (enough for me to practice Tai Chi), not dirty, but walls thin as I can hear the TV of the next room. Hotel occupies a large site area with gound and first floors only. Location wise, 2 mins walk from the station called Symphony and this hotel is on the same road of many 5 star hotels like Sheraton, Westin etc. There are restaurants and a supermarket called Shaw near those hotels. Price low in USA standard, US$99 plus tax round 14.5%. Breakfast excluded as usual in USA. Beware, the price does not include a smile of the front desk staff. I don't care or mind though. And, many guests I met are teenagers and they are quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK hotel. Great for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: pete_wright16
Reviews.Content: Positives: Fantastic location - walkable to lots of boston attractions. Big rooms, with big beds. Clean. Negatives: Tired/old. staff good (although when we checked out we had a phone bill despite using the phone, and the receptionist man was very rude when we questioned it). Overall a good budget hotel in a great location for what we paid

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: WlnutTchr
Reviews.Content: Travel to Boston/Brookline at least twice a year to visit family. Have stayed at the Marriott but wanted to save money. Relied on reviews from TripAdvisor to help me select a less expensive hotel. But the "find" was found to be unsatisfactory. Hairs on bedsheet (not ours), stains on wallpaper, old small TV, didn't receive wake-up call I had programmed on the telephone, white painted shelves were scuffed and needed a fresh coat, heating system too loud to leave on. Ambience of a motel rather than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spend some extra money and go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: ZombieKnowledge
Reviews.Content: An altogether lackluster and uncomfortable experience, The Midtown Hotel inspired me to resolve to stay at a better location during my next trip to Boston. I've never gone to a hotel that ran out of extra pillows before. I've also never stayed in a room where the heating system had a mind of its own before; Apparently it felt the room should've been 90 degrees during the day and 40 overnight. The very friendly technician who assisted me, himself the opposite of the cold lady at the front desk, said the temperature problem is a recurring one. The staff seemed to be a mixture of friendly individuals and those who were clearly unconcerned with the needs of their guests. Even leaving the hotel was a minor inconvenience. I thought I had my parking stamp validated through 4 PM, yet the machine in the parking lot unformed me it wasn't. So off I went to have the ticket revalidated, which the front desk attendant did after resolving an issue with another departing guest: a guy who was charged for having an extra cot in his room for 3 nights, despite only having it for 1. Don't consider The Midtown Hotel unless your finances demand you must.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cleoder
Reviews.Content: This 2 story hotel is located by the Prudential Center on Huntington Ave. The room was well priced for the location in the heart of the city and parking is available on site for an additional fee. Room was clean and quiet although the TV was small and old, also WI-FI was only available for $9.95/24 hour period. A little pricey given most places have it free. Desk personnel were very friendly and access to tour buses is close by as is dinning. Garage was a little small but then we have a pickup truck. Had to get in and out by a service entrance as would any larger vehicle as main garage entrance/exit is too low. There was a coffee maker but fridges were an extra charge. The heating system is a little wonky but didn't bother us too much given temperatures outside where well above seasonal. Given the price of lodging in Boston this place is very reasonable and would recommend to everyone going there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great price, perfect location for my needs”
Reviews.Author: JessicaD81
Reviews.Content: The space was clean, the front desk folks were pleasant and professional. The cleaning staff, whom I met a couple times during my stay were thorough, and only entered my room when the "Do Not Disturb" sing was not displayed. I will definitely use them again for future visits to Boston, and plan to highly suggest their establishment to all my friends and acquaintances who like a great deal, and well-priced lodgings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - great staff - great service”
Reviews.Author: FatCatAnna
Reviews.Content: I actually don't really want to spread the word about this hotel - as maybe they'll jack up the prices afterwards - but I felt it my duty to let others know that this is a great place to stay for the price. We lucked in as we were going to the New England Boat Show so got a rate a few dollars below the normal. The staff were great (Marie is really nice) - as well as a few others who gave us great tips on where to eat for not too much. The hotel is right next to the Boston Symphony Hall and also university - so area is full of life! One thing that was really nice was having a free show a few doors down from us - a musician was playing his viola - and I stood outside their door - in awe of the music pouring out of their room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston location”
Reviews.Author: RobinS8
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston with a friend of mine and we stayed at the Midtown Hotel. The price was great and so was the location. We could walk to a lot of things and public transportation was also close by. It's definitely not a fancy luxury hotel but it was clean and well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location but no frills”
Reviews.Author: welshbeastie
Reviews.Content: Not an attractive looking place but that really does not worry me. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Room large and clean, beds looked new and were comfy. Bathroom more than adequate, . Rooms cleaned to a good standard every day, plenty of towels etc. Tea and coffee facilities very good. Heating system very outdated but provided good heat. No restaurant or bar, but I had no intention of being in the hotel much of each day so that was fine. Excellent location - 1 minutes to symphony metro station. 2 minutes walk to the prudential shopping centre. Located close to hilton hotel and I have no doubt their facities would be far superior, but the midtown at a third of their price is good value , in a good locaion and is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for couple of nights stay”
Reviews.Author: SueMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Good location for the price you pay. Parking is undercover. Close to Boston central - walking distance to attractions. Good do with replacing beds - you rolled into the middle of the bed. Bitterly cold day we visited so we caught the sightseeing trolley - great idea for the weather we had that day - 21 degrees celcius! (included wind chill). Boston is a beautiful city and would like to go back in the wamer months. For the amount of time we spend in the hotel room it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: claireharbor
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Boston for a few nights and had a good stay here. Slightly put off that the hotel looked like a motel but nice inside. Swimming pool was very basic but rooms where nice. Ok it isn't the plushist hotel out there but in terms of value and location it was great (mins walk to shopping mall and train staion).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Economical for a Place to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Crimson667
Reviews.Content: When in Boston as a tourist, the point of visiting is to see the sights and experience the history. A hotel should, therefore, be convenient, reasonably priced, and a decent place to sleep after all the walking around is done. Midtown Hotel fits all of those requirements. Why spend an entire day in the hotel room when there's an entire city outside to play in? A king-bed room is slightly larger than average. The construction is somewhat dated, and can be a bit cold in the winter, but short of tearing down the entire building and reconstructing it, one has to accept some limitations. Amenities are minimal, but again, when your purpose in Boston is to roam the city, the hotel doesn't need very many. Shopping and dining are all withing walking distance from the hotel, as are a number of subway stations which can take you wherever you wish to go in the Greater Boston area, which, combined with Midtown Hotel's comparably lower rates, makes it the perfect base of operations for a leisure trip. The Symphony Station of the Green Line is closest to the hotel, while the Mass Ave. Station of the Orange Line is a few blocks further away. Both can take you anywhere, from Fanueil Hall to Charlestown to downtown and to points beyond. Wireless Internet is offered for a daily fee. Snacks are available in vending machines in the hallways as well as from a snack counter in the lobby. Parking is available in the attached garage for a daily fee. An outdoor pool is available in-season. The hotel staff are evidently accustomed to welcoming sightseers, so directions are just a question away (and like with all aspects in Boston, don't approach a person with an attitude and you won't get one in return). Cabs and tour trolleys make regular stops but catch them quickly, because the hotel is right on a main street and does not have a cab stand. Overall, this is a no-frills hotel that does its job: provide a place to sleep in a convenient location for a reasonable price. Very few hotels in the downtown area are priced this low.

Reviews.Title: “check in checkout”
Reviews.Author: twingris
Reviews.Content: arrived after delayed flight from london. virgin had booked us in after i told them i did not want to drive 3 hours to stowe vt after the flight .we might aswell have plodded on the hotel is without doubt the worst ive ever been in thlobby was drab and dark checkin was ok and the staff were nice enough but the hotel is awfull when we were walking to the room i couldnt work out why they wasnt any carpets in the corridors it was like a prison the room was big but very dull the mattress was old and flat the kids were killing them selves laughing the wife was mortified we checked out sharpish the next morning not good

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great price, great place!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jchuser
Reviews.Content: We booked this room based on a friends advice and I thought the price was too good to be true but was happily surprised. Got there, was able to park at the hotel, I was greeted by the front desk guy who actually looked like he was happy to be there. Our room was very nice ( I gave it a very good because it wasn't the Sheraton but it also didn't cost half as much) furniture seemed newer, very clean, and I wasn't affraid to sit on the bed :). Great place will go back any time!!!

Reviews.Title: “People and Placement is the key”
Reviews.Author: brustersdawg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Midtown Hotel in October and it was amazing. Its just a skip away from the Prudential Center and 3 different Train stops. The staff is very freindly and treat you like family. My friend and I had the best time in Boston because everything was easy to get to from here and the hotel was very accomodating. I would recomend this place to anyone who wants to have a great stay and enjoy Boston for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place”
Reviews.Author: Mandarine84
Reviews.Content: They first gave us a room with two double beds even if I had requested a king size bed. When I was moved to a different room, that room smelled like smoke although it was a non-smoking room. Actually, the entire hallway smelled like smoke. The bathroom wasn't that clean and the hotel itself was pretty noisy, meaning that the walls were very thin. Granted the room was cheap, I would not stay at this place another time.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap”
Reviews.Author: 2travel2much
Reviews.Content: First went here many years ago, have been back perhaps 3 times. Definitely improved, renovated. Near mall for breakfast. Pay for internet. Clean enough, not cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, affordable and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: penelopeSalem_MA
Reviews.Content: The Midtown Hotel provides a clean room with friendly staff. We had a comfortable stay. Conviently located for Bostons sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, cheap and convenient”
Reviews.Author: jacob_g
Reviews.Content: After a 6 night stay at the Midtown hotel, I can say that it has been an excellent all round experience. The staff were very friendly and helpful. On our first night here, there was a problem with the thermostat in the room (nothing to make it uncomfortable, just a little cooler than I would usually like it) and I reported it to the front office early the next morning. They were extremely apologetic and it was fixed while we were out of our room during the day. I paid $100 p/n inclusive of taxes for our stay here and I must say that for a hotel this conveniently located with reasonable amenities, this was a total bargain. In terms of the few drawbacks, as many other reviewers have said, the hallways and lobby look dated and a bit dingy, but i would think that the rooms have been renovated, as they are warm, comfortable and very large. The only other drawbacks observed were that they plumbing from adjacent rooms was a bit loud in the morning, but aside from that I never heard any of the neighbours. Also, the wireless internet is quite expensive at $9.95 for 24 hours, ouch! These small problems not withstanding, I would definitely stay here again. Thanks to the Midtown hotel for making our first trip to Boston enjoyable and inexpensive!

Reviews.Title: “Well priced typical budget urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: psybrdelic
Reviews.Content: Actually, I should preface this with the fact that I recieved "Buy two nights, get one free." So my bill ended up being about $200 for three nights and an addional $18 per day for parking. For an urban area this hotel is acceptable. It is located about a block and a half from the Prud center and multiple subway stops. The hotel itself has it's setbacks, but these do not supercede the bargain. Originally we were put in a back room overlooking a parking lot with no table or desk. After requesting a better room, we recieved a view of the Church across the street and a larger room with a table. However, the room is old overall. It is not dirty, just run down. There's no bar or resturant on site. The desk employees were helpful and friendly, as was the concierge. Just an FYI there are quite a few Europeans here because it is a Berlitz recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Night Out”
Reviews.Author: willowcake
Reviews.Content: The Midtown Hotel is a great choice for a great night getaway with friends. The staff was helpful, efficient and friendly. The room was comfortable, clean and spacious. A great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel - read this before you book!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseWestcountry
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Midtown for a two night stay. I was a little concerned by the reviews, but having visited the states extensively over the last few years and never having had a bad experience with an American hotel, thought it would probably be ok! How wrong I was. The lobby is grey and dismal with a dirty, old smell about it. Check in was fine and we then dragged our luggage to the first floor. On entering our room it smelt very strongly of stale tobacco. I returned to reception and asked for a room that did not smell. They began by being very gracious and apologetic and gave me a new room immediately, advising a staff member would check out the smelly room! We dragged our cases to our new room on the second floor. Quicker to drag your cases than take the elevator! Our new room was awful, dismal, mismatching wall paper, broken window, broken towel rail, the list goes on it was just gross. We decided as the hotel was booked and paid for that we would grit our teeth and get on with it! We left the hotel via reception, in order to find something to eat. When passing back through the reception area an employee of the hotel started shouting across the room that "there was nothing wrong with the room (whatever number it was) that I had asked to be moved from." It was rude, unecessary, gross behaviour and done so that I could here him. I can only assume the employee who checked out the room had aclimatised to the smell of the hotel, but please be assured it stank. I have been travelling for over 34 years to many countries and have never had to ask for a room change before! With regards to the beds, you can see the mattresses as they have no valences, and they look old, tired and sag in the middle. I am not sure if the bed linen was off white or cream, but it was old and horrible. I have never ever felt unhappy about getting into a hotel bed, but I did at the Midtown, and covered my pillow with a T.shirt and wore as much clothing as I could in bed, so that I did not have to touch the bed clothes. It was all very old, very dated and very unacceptable. The rooms are noisey and you were kept awake by the noise. When we were waiting for our shuttle to the airport, the reception staff talked noisely amongst themselve and there appeared to be a total lack of professionlism. Rest rooms in lobby were very unclean when we used them. This hotel is in urgent need of a face lift. If you are on a budget, wait unitl you can afford a better hotel, staying here will ruin your trip. The location is ok but, we walked most of Boston so I cannot even sell it to you on location as anywhere would be fine!

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: HappyGermany
Reviews.Content: Filthy rooms, non-working toilets, non-working telephones, unfriendly staff are few words that can be used for describing this hotel. I bet if someone who has already stayed in this hotel will ever go again. If you want to have a nightmare, then choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fair for the price”
Reviews.Author: Deborah-AnnB
Reviews.Content: Not a 5 star but if you're looking for a place to leave your stuff and just sleep, this is worth it. Parking is extra, but negotiable. I couldn't get free, but I did get a discount. Leave your car and walk across to the subway. easiest way to get downtown. Mall within walking distance. No lounge, no food, but breakfast is a short walk and pubs are near the mall. Had a great Martini at the Sheraton. Must see while in Boston - The Liberty Hotel. Was once a prison - now an upscale hotel. The bar has interesting mixes and the lower level restaurant is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in a good location. Large rooms, but could do with refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: womblingaround
Reviews.Content: Midtown Hotel is very centrally located and easy to find and just a couple of minutes form the T-line. The rooms are really large considering the price and our room was clean with comfortable beds. However, the small window in our room didn't shut properly and there were no safe storage areas within the room (ie wardrobe safe etc) meaning we carried passports etc around at all times. Lot of noise from other rooms, not very good sound proofing, you could clearly hear people talking in the next room and if they flushed their toilet in the night it was loud enough to wake us up. The air conditioning/heating didn't appear to work either. Rooms were quite dark and as mentioned the whole hotel looked like it was in need of decoaration - our room looked like it hadn't been decorated for a good few years. All in all, a good price for a great location but very basic.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirebrowns
Reviews.Content: never ever go to this hotel it is the worst one i have ever stayed at. It smells - badly. Room basic and clean - just. Mattress sags so you dont get a good nights sleep. When I booked this i knew it was going to be basic but not this basic.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: anderson22
Reviews.Content: Close to the Symphony station on the green line. This hotel was great value and in a super location. We paid USD 99 per night for a double room. Prudential tower just over the road. Loads of great restaurants nearby. Ten minute walk to Copley Square. Would stay here again if I returned to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but needs a facelift...”
Reviews.Author: Barcelonamom
Reviews.Content: Location can't be beat. Three blocks from Northeastern Univ and near the Prudential Center. Hotel reminds me of a budget motel. Inside decor very outdated. Our room was big, but tired looking. Bathroom was okay, no problems. Got a good deal of $99 a night, so it was okay. Other hotels much higher, as it is move in week for Northeastern. Parking $18. Stayed two nights. When we left the first day to go sightseeing, I had left a sock in the middle of the room, not realizing. When we came back the room was cleaned, but the sock was still there. Strange. Would only go back if I couldn't find a good deal on one of the other hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “To Quote Bette Davis - "What a dump!"”
Reviews.Author: BassoonMom
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for one night after settling my daughter into New England Conservatory. Picked it for its close location to the school and booked the room online for $169 for the night which is a pretty good deal for a hotel that seemed close to everything . After arriving in Boston, I could tell from the exterior that it was an older property but I figured it's only for one night so who cares? I checked in around 9:30PM and was told that it would cost me $18 to park my car in their garage for the night. I thought that was a bit strange, having never had to pay for parking at a hotel before but I figured this was a big city so maybe it was normal. I eventually found the main elevator after dragging my bag upstairs and down a musty, dark hallway only to find that when I got to my room, I was given key cards that apparently did not work. I went back down to the desk, they reprogrammed the key cards and I hauled my bag back upstairs to the room again, only to find that the cards STILL didn't work. Back down to the lobby again and told that I would have to be escorted to my room by someone with a Master Key, which did finally work. Once in the room, I found it clean enough I guess, but definitely dated and run down. All I wanted to do was watch get something to eat (which involved being escorted back to my room after I got dinner, with the master key) and watch TV. But The TV channel displays did not match what was actually on the TV. They said they had HBO but in fact, when I tuned to HBO, it was another channel entirely. Giving up on TV I felt a bit warm in the room. Unfortunately the air conditioning did not work. That must be why they left one of the windows open. My room was facing the very noisy Huntington Avenue. So when I tried to shut the window so I could get some sleep, I found that the window was broken and could not be shut. I had to listen to trucks blaring by all night long. To add insult to injury when my bill arrived in the morning, they charged me $200/night for the night instead of the $169 that I had booked online bringing the total bill to over $250 for a crappy night sleep in a noisy room. When I complained to the manager, they did fix the bill and waived the $18 parking charge as a way of apologizing for all the inconveniences. Still I not recommend this hotel to anyone even though it IS conveniently located unless you are willing to spend a good deal of money on a completely budget, no frills hotel. I have stayed in crappy Red Roof Inns on the side of a highway nicer than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Raggy999
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 10.00pm after a bit of a nightmare journey, the receptionist was just not with it and she was more interested in a private phone conversation. When we eventually got to our room the so called double bed was like a single bed but just a bit bigger! The plumbing made such a terrible noise all night! The Air Conditioning was like a washing machine spinning in full spin cycle, the room was a nightmare. The bathroom and sink were split with no door on the sink section! In all fairness the maids cleaned the room spot on but we will never go back to this Hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: batmankaren
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about this hotel because of all the negative reviews but it was totally fine. It was clean, the shower was warm, the beds were comfortable and the price was right. The pool was a nice bonus. The rooms were a bit small but I expect that from a city hotel. The rooms and hallways could use an update but as long as everything is functioning and clean the decor doesn't matter to me. There was a mistake on our bill and I was ready to have to argue about it but the staff was friendly and it was fixed right away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Road Trip Pitstop. Clean and Close.”
Reviews.Author: jamesnunn
Reviews.Content: Completed an ambitious road trip from Toronto>Boston>New York City with some friends earlier this year. We booked online from London, England. The 3 reasons we choose this hotel were... 1. 4 friends sharing one room- check. 2. Parking available on site for our car- check 3. Cheap price (especially when split between 4)- check We arrived later than expected to the hotel. No problem, friendly staff explained to us how the parking worked etc.. and even let me pay on a UK cash card as opposed to a credit card (which we did not have). Our stay lasted 2 days, we spent little time in the room but this was because we were sight seeing/drinking.. The room was basic, but huge. More than enough room for 4. Fresh towels and sheets. We felt safe enough leaving our possessions in the suitcases. The hotel is on the edge of the city and right on the main road -easy to find from the freeway, great for a roadtrip! We has a road facing window and was quiet as any city hotel. Its on the outskirts but not too far. There is a metro line about 2 minute walk (which will take you anywhere in the city) or alternatively about 15 min walk to the center of the city (we walked, it was enjoyable and the weather was good), a cab cost about $8-10 dollars. Positives: Boston is my favorite American city. Lots of beauty and history, I would recommend taking a look at the wharf, and the freedom trail, maybe the Cheers bar. HAHA. It also has great midweek nightlife and the bars felt more like London than New York. There was also a biggish student vibe but not overwhelming to the more mature visitor. We had a lovely evening on UNION STREET- there was about 10 pubs/bars each with is own varying entertainment (live music/sports/karaoke) Negatives: No gym, and pool was closed in April.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel; "T" or Metro 2 blocks, Mall 1 block, food 1 block, clean, pool, friendly would use again.”
Reviews.Author: ANHLondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in a very convenient, accessible spot, near T station, adjacent to a large Mall, otherside of Mall, main shopping street with Pharmacy. Great street restaurant one block from hotel, good food and prices. Area felt safe, Pleasant and helpful staff. Pool a great plus. Stayed in room 41 a/c, large room,small bathroom? Sofa bed plus two double beds, TV, hot drinks, two arm chairs, tables etc. Clean, tidy efficient. Can provide a shuttle to and from the airport. Wireless Internet available at $9 per day, PC in lobby area available at lesser cost.. Small convenience store one block, hotel has a car park. I would use again if in Boston - the ultimate test? group, Dad and two daughters 21 and 16 all agree hotel was fine Small bathroom huge room?? Hope this helps. by the way if staying more than one day in Boston, by a weekly T card rather than two one day tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Dog-Friendly, Nice Pool, Convenient Self-Park”
Reviews.Author: BlueEyedMavrick
Reviews.Content: I spent a great deal of time here while my mother stayed here on her visit to Boston. I used to be a hotel manager in Boston, and this is hands-down the best value you are going to get in the city, without question. One great perk is the self-park, which means you can come and go as you wish, without having to tip a valet each time. Just make sure you bring the ticket that you receive entering the lot, to the front desk to have it validated each time. The pool area had a lifeguard on duty, which is quite nice if you have children and like having that extra eye on your kids. The pool area is basic but very clean. There are tables and chairs there and it's sort of like a little oasis in the middle of the city. We also had a room near the pool, but there were no noise issues. The room is spacious and modestly updated. The only issue in our room was that the television was low, and not exactly in front of either of the double beds, but it was fine for us. While there is no breakfast at this hotel, if you walk one block west, you can find Dunkin Doughnuts and other places to eat. We did have a dog in the room, and there is an additional charge to have it in the room. Although this is of course not ideal, it is to be expected, considering that no other modestly-priced (under $200/night) hotels in Boston even accept dogs. The housekeeping staff was pleasant and always greeted us whenever we walked in the hallways. Best value in the city, with a great location as the icing on the cake. I am surprised that with how valuable real-estate is at this location, that it still exists and charges such modest prices. I would absolutely recommend to anyone who seeks a basic, comfortable, value steps away from Copley Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Guinie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for its proximity to Fenway Park and the Museum of Fine Arts, with an easy walk to both. Room was clean, roomy enough for two, king-size bed, plenty of storage space. Bathroom was clean and sufficiently supplied; shower sprayer might be too short for some. Small fridges available for small daily rental fee. Front desk people were friendly, helpful, offered maps and directions. One night parking available for free if you present a Red Sox ticket, available through this season according to check-in person. Had a good late breakfast at Thornton's, just down the street. If you are sensitive to noise, take earplugs. Party in room beneath ours was noisy at 2:30 AM, but front desk responded to our call within 10 minutes. Walls are thin, some outside traffic noise. Overall good value for price. Got a great price by checking in repeatedly on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for no frills trip”
Reviews.Author: heddlemaid
Reviews.Content: This place is a great deal for a no-fills overnight. Convenient location, clean rooms and friendly, helpful staff make this a winner. Any type of internet connection costs extra (either in room or in lobby), but we didn't need to stay connected on our overnight. Booking on-line on their site gave us the best price. We requested rooms next to each other, and they did us one better by giving us connecting rooms. No great views (room overlooked inner courtyard parking area), but they were quiet. Thornton's Restaurant, just a very short walk up the street, serves a good breakfast. Be aware that the showers are short - at about 5'10" I fit in, but had to duck down to wash my hair. My 6'2" son would find it difficult to stand up in the tub.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: MagicMoments_16
Reviews.Content: The Midtown is a fairly basic, spartan hotel but ultimately it is good value for money For the price paid (compared to what others are charging), you get a clean, reasonably sized room and best of all, you are in a great location close to the heart of Boston. So value for money is very good. As mentioned, the hotel itself is pretty spartan with limited amenities. I found the service to be OK although not outstanding. And the room I was in was fine - reasonably spacious and clean with everything I needed. Not outstanding but not terrible either. The best part of the hotel is where it is located. Close to the subway, close to the city and close to most of the major attractions. You won't be disappointed with this aspect of things.

Reviews.Title: “A Two Star Hotel But A Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: canarsie69
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for the second time at the Midtown Hotel/ $89/Night plus $18 for parking. Found it abit improved since stay of a few years ago. Clean, helpful staff and great location. Coffee maker in room. Ten minute walk to Newbury Street, 20 minutes to Boston Common. Can't be beat at that price!

Reviews.Title: “A pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveller674
Reviews.Content: We arrived to this hotel after a nightmare hourney as their was a snow emergency declared in Boston. Our room was very spacious and had 2 big double beds, and plenty of space. We had a TV and radio. The bathroom was clean and the shower good. Although the rooms were basic, they were clean and comfortable. The hotel has a pool but when we were there it was covered in 2 foot of snow! The location is good for exploring the surrounding area, we found lots of nice pubs, restaurants and shops, but you would have to travel into the centre of Boston by bus or subway. We took the subway a few stops and found a great big shopping mall where we went crazy in the sales :) We also walked through the park and visited the iconic "Cheers" pub, which i recommend. All in all the hotel was a great base for this, although there aren;t that many facilities in the hotel itself, but i would go back if i was on a budget. Be took the

Reviews.Title: “Just returned - had to review this GREAT place for auditioning families”
Reviews.Author: Minooka_Mary
Reviews.Content: Parents- Audition at NEC or Berklee for your kid? THIS is the place! Love - just love this hotel. Staff is incredibly helpful. Parking is great - in a lot of cases you can see your car from your hotel window. Rooms were recently re-painted. Hotel is quiet and a very reasonable size. It is unbelievably low key place in the heart of a busy city. It is unique, It is clean, it is quiet, It is unbelievably easy to access public transportation. I cannot say enough about this place. If I HAD to critcize I would have painted different, less neutral paint color to go with 60's motif and make it more trendy - but hey - that is if I HAD to criticize. Love the atmosphere, Love the architecture, Love the ease, Love the location, Love the price!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Basic - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: London-Gal08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Midtown on a freezing, snowy week in March 08. The hotel was warm, clean and suited our budget perfectly. I did a lot of research and realised that we favoured location over luxury as we were going to be out exploring most of the day. The front desk staff were efficient and the old guy trying to sell theme tickets at the door was a sweetie. The airport shuttle service was great and picked us up right at the hotel door. This hotel had so much nearby, the subway, Copley Place, Prudential Centre, Fenway Park and it was so easy to walk everywhere too. We had an internal room overlooking the pool so didnt notice any traffic noise, but the rooms were a bit thin and we did hear our neighbours tv and stuff and the water cisterns were noisy too when others were having showers in neighbouring rooms but this still did not affect our stay too much and for its location and price we would happily recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, great location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter4989
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 3 day stay at the Midtown Hotel in Boston recently. We picked the hotel for it excellent location, and it didn't dissapoint. It's around the corner from 2 "T" stops, and within walking distance of the city centre, as well as the Cambridge area. Apart from the location the hotel itself is functional, rather than exceptional. The staff are friendly, and the hotel is clean and has all the facilities you'd need. It could do with a refurb though, as it looks like it's not been updated since the 80's! Also on our first night we ended up in a very noisy room at the very back of the hotel. When we complained we were promptly moved to a new room nearer to the lobby area, which was much less noisy albeit it somewhat smaller. The rooms are clean, spaceous and have all the usual facilities, coffee/tea maker, iron, tv, etc. Beds were soft, big and comfortable. Not bad for $110 a night! No breakfest is provided, but there's plenty of diner's and cafe's around so that didn't pose much of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “ok basic hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: cityrunner
Reviews.Content: ok basic hotel, not the prettiest but functional and fairly cental location, though on a big main road. Feels a bit like a residence for students but clean and big rooms, just not fancy or luxurious. I got a very cheap rate on hotwaire so worth it for one night at $120.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,thats about all”
Reviews.Author: gingersmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the start of our New England Tour,which was a package so we had no choice in our accomodation. Guess it must be cheap as most of the other hotels we stayed at were of a similar level. On a tour you only stay at a hotel for one or maybe two nights so you just put up with it and move on. Well,we were glad to move on from this miserable place! The room was dreary,although cleanbut the bed was comfortable, which was our main concern.Was extremely hard to turn around in the bathroom without bashing your elbows or knees! At least the room we had wasn't far from reception so we didn't get lost in the corridors( as many others in our party did.) It also overlooked the courtyard car park ,so was fairly quiet,although there were ,what sounded like a family with children above us,who liked to run the length of the room with their boots on! Tip: take earplugs! Would have liked an on-site bar to relax in during the evening too but we were told by our guide that the Christian Science Centre opposite had owned the land and stipulated that when the hotel was built,there was to be no alchohol sold on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Well located basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandTeenfamily
Reviews.Content: \We stayed at the beginning of our New England tour & wanted to be able to see the city easily. Unexciting from the outside this fitted the bill, being clean & quiet, with no restaurant but near the Prudential Centre that has plenty. On the Trolley bus route we had no need of a car to see the city. The lifts do not go to the lobby level so not recommended for those with pushchairs/strollers or for the less mobile. The staff were effecient but perehaps more used to business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “What a Little Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: WILLYONE
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six night stay in Boston. And what a fine city it is as well! Having decided to get away for a few days, i thought it was time to heed my brothers advice and book a trip to Boston. He only had good things to say about it, so i thought it was time to find out for myself especialy as i'd never been before. I have to say i was rather alarmed at the prices of hotels there, and it was as much for this reason that i decided to book The Midtown. All other options were too expensive!! I must confess to being slightly concerned as to whether i'd done the right thing. The pictures on the net didn't fill me with hope as they made it out to be little more than a cheap motel, and as the shuttle driver pulled up outside these fears were enhanced even more! I wondered what on earth i'd let myself in for! Well what a surprise...the very friendly staff checked me in and arranged for my bag to be sent to my room. The corridors were clean and tidy, i also saw drinks and ice machines. Arrived at my room and was greeted by a huge area..Ok, nothing special in the decor etc, but of a high basic standard. Bathroom with toilet seperated with a door to the wash basin area..not big but perfectly acceptable. Once again very clean. The only slight downer was that i had one of the 'road views' so i did have a fair amount of road noise, but you can't have everything! A knock on the door and there was the bell man with my bag..he gave me his name and said if i needed any help with maps, directions or any information i need only ask. You cant want for more! The staff were like this the whole time i was there and i can't praise them enough. The only negative aspect of the hotel is the lack of an on-site restaurant..now does this matter when i'm sure most people would eat out anyway? Well i believe you should at least have the option. As others have said there is Thorntons, a nice breakfast cafe which is three hundred yards down the road, as well as the Prudential Centre which is a five minute walk away where you have numerous eating options. Room service was always done efficiently, i only actually met the maid on my last morning and that was only as i was staying in the room a little longer due to checking out! Check out was also painless, they also stored my bag for me for the day as i was catching a mid evening flight back to the UK. As regards transportation, the trolley tour bus stops right outside the hotel, the 'T' stop is in the Prudential Centre, which as i've said is a five minute walk, and if you'd rather walk, well thats fine as it is such a compact city you can virtually walk anywhere, and its the best way to look around anyway! A quick word about Boston...Superb! So much to do and see. If you need to get out of the city for a day or two, you've got superb coastline to explore..I took a day excursion to Cape Cod..what a stunning area. All in all one of the best trips to the States i've had. If you book The Midtown you may fear the worst, but i reckon you'll think to yourself..'I'd be more than happy to stay here again' which is exactly what i thought as i was driven to Logan Airport for my flight home. The location is spot on, the staff are very friendly and the hotel throughout is very clean. Dont let the pictures put you off staying at this little gem! A big name chain it may not be, but it offers the personal touch to your stay which they just cant compete with! Highly Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall for price”
Reviews.Author: SENORAWestMidlands
Reviews.Content: -Stayed here for two nights at the start of a New England tour and again at the end of tour for another two nights. Hotel overall was OK....small two storey hotel conveniently situated in city. Staff friendly and efficient. No restaurant on site but a Thorntons restaurant one hundred yards along street for breakfast and snacks, so too is a small convenience store, plus at the second traffic light turn right, walk fifty yards to a 7-11 convenience store, walk another 100 yards past 7-11 to a liquor store. Rooms good size but bathrooms tiny, with very small vanity area outside bathroom. Plumbing noisy on occasions. Plenty of towels, changed daily. Comfortable beds. For our first two nights we were in room 134 at the back of the hotel with a small window overlooking parking area and another opaque window looking onto interior corridor so very little natural light. However this room was quiet. We had no qualms about returning here for our last two nights in Boston. On our return we were in room 110 on first floor overlooking sidewalk and road, much more light, room spec the same but slightly larger with more storage space and more noise which however did diminish at night, except for the family of elephants in the room above ours. Maybe a good idea to ask for a room on upper floor. Diagonally across the road is The Prudential Centre for shopping and a food court. Check out the view from the 50th floor Skywalk. Just a few yards further is a large Shaws supermarket outside of which is the starting point for the Boston Duck Tour(very overated and overpriced, I would give this one a miss). With the exception of a splash down in The Charles River you would see the same sights on the city tour. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Copley Square, Boston Common, Quincy Market and very pleasant Frog Pond gardens. Plenty of restaurants and fast food outlets nearby. All in all a good place to stay without breaking the bank. Would stay here again if in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “horrid housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: shansen1984
Reviews.Content: we arrived and thought this was an ok hotel until we realized the bedding smelled of men's cologne and low and behold we look under the bed and a used condom wrapper was laying there. When we told the staff including the night manager nobody apologised and they acted as if we were bothering them with something that was no big deal. Then when they agreed to wash the linens they took over an hour to bring them back because they didn't have clean extras. Really I needed to go to bed but my fiancÃ©, baby and I were kept up waiting for our linen to return. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short break to Boston”
Reviews.Author: janani
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Midtown Hotel for 3 nights. Location is great - near shopping malls, 5 mins walk from a subway station, approx 25 mins walk to Boston Common and Downtown area. The outside of the building is really unattractive and the corridors are poorly lit with stained carpets so we didn't get a great first impression. However the room was huge with 2 double beds and a sofa. It was clean and well maintained. The bathroom was small but had a good power shower. There is no restaurant for breakfast but there is a cafe down the road. We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel and I think it is good value for a trip where you will be spending most of your time sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is old and a dive”
Reviews.Author: Bulldogfootball
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an overexpensive dive. The air doesn't cool the rooms as its on or off those are the two settings. The beds are old and uncomfortable, the decor came from the 70's, the pool had green mold all over the walls. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Jo_Q_London
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Midtown Hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of September and I can't fault the property. It was easy to locate from the T stops nearby - and really convenient to access all the sights of Boston. The rooms were really spacious with a huge comfortable bed, plenty of spare pillows and blankets if you needed them, and a compact but clean bathroom. The staff were wonderfully helpful - accommodating every request with politeness. It's not a fancy property - don't book here expecting 5* luxury, but for the price you pay, it's excellent

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Midtown”
Reviews.Author: ASTRA5
Reviews.Content: Just back from Boston, stayed at the Midtown for 9 nights I could not fault it. The rooms are clean, the beds are very comfortable,plenty space in the room, asked for a room at the back and it was very quiet. The staff were helpful at all times. Its in a great location, there are three T stations nearby.The nearest for breakfast is Thorntons. Its ok , got sick of all the eggs on the menu.Plenty restaurants within 10 mins walk on Newbury Street and visit Uno on Boylston Street for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for the budget minded traveler”
Reviews.Author: BAGPasadena
Reviews.Content: Midtown Hotel is a bargain with a great location and a superior staff. If you want to spend your money on 15 pillows and a heavenly bed, then you must. But f you plan on seeing Boston and not sit in your room all day, have a central location for walking, eating and Boston transit, and spending your money on Boston fun, then the Midtown is your hotel. It's basic decor and not fancy but it's clean, convenient and reasonable. I've stayed at the upscale hotels on business and for conferences and have heard every word and movement in the room next door. Ask for a room away from the street at the Midtown and you will sleep well in quiet; we never heard our neighbors. The staff at the Midtown were "heavenly", meeting all our requests and going the extra mile on two occasions. No room service but the close access to the Prudential Center with bridge to Copley and Shaws Market, made it convenient for a variety of eating choices which were more reasonable than room service. Thanks Midtown, you are a gem from the past.

Reviews.Title: “Simply welcome: Good value, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: isabelbrinck
Reviews.Content: The layout of this hotel is a bit of a trip in time. It has a very long halls and is very low (looks like 2-3 stories high), like an old-school motel. There is even an outdoor pool in an enclosed courtyard, surrounded by floor-to-cieling windows and carpeted (that's right) floor. The style of the hotel sign kind of says it all. But if this is discouraging to you, it shouldn't be. Aside from the fact that there are steps (?!) leading to the first floor hall, everything else about the place is comfortable and modern enough. The room layouts may be weird (small bathroom with door separating it from the sink; no full length mirror), but the furniture is well maintained, the carpet is impeccable, the bedding is comfortable, and there is ample storage space. The room was also huge, even by American standards. Oh! And the windows open. The hotel has no in-house restaurant or room service but they recommend a great cafÃ© down the street and the keys advertise a dine-in service. My complaints were: a noisy vending machine above my room which made me request a change; the tub didn't drain well; the bathroom fan didn't seem to work. Above average: the friendly staff (90% of them anyway), and the proximity to the Hynes Convention Center at a comparatively super low price in relation to other properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Musty Smelly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scoobysnacker
Reviews.Content: Staying at this Hotel, worst part of the trip! The room had a very Musty smell to it. You can hear your neighbors as if they were staying in the room with you. Bathrooms need to be updated. The average guest must be about 5 feet tall since, the bed was not long enough and the shower head was at eye level and I am not quite six feet tall. The pool area is very dirty, the pool towels were thrown in a pile on the ground. Not too pleased with the weekend staff! The price is great but, if you want to be nickeled and dime for everything else stay here. Cheap ...cheap...cheap! Did I say Cheap?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great city stay”
Reviews.Author: AngelaMMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: Had read the mixed reviews of the Midtown and wondered what we'd encounter - but absolutely nothing significantly wrong with this hotel. Excellent location - very close to the Prudential and Copley centres - both fantastic places to shop, shop, shop! T stations close by - just so convenient. Wonderful views from the window of the Christian Science buildings. This place cannot be beaten for value AND location. Our room was the largest we'd had all holiday. Bathroom was small - but good enough for what you need it for. Beds perfectly comfortable. We had a room overlooking the road - no significant noise issues. The check in staff were very friendly. Yes they do charge for parking but 1) cheaper than other places and 2) once you parked it there you never need the car again. Plus, we had a late flight so they let us pay for another day's parking after checking out. Pool looked very good - but I overheard someone saying how cold it was so I avoided using it!! The corridors did smell a little of cigarette smoke (and I'm a smoker and can't usually smell it!) but nothing in the room (we had a non-smoking room). Yes - the hotel is plain and maybe a little dated but for it is value for money and excellent location we would certainly use again - just think about the extra money you can spend on shopping!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for us, NO complaints.”
Reviews.Author: recorder
Reviews.Content: Boston is a little expensive for us but this place fit our budget. Sometimes though thats the only thing thats right, but not this time. We're a family of four wanting to see a Red Sox game, take a Duck tour, and walk the Freedom Trail and tour Boston from the observatory of the Prudential building. We arrived early and found that our room was ready and we could settle in. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. All we could ask for. Of the seven places we stayed on our 12 day trip, this was in the upper group. It was in walking distance of Fenway Park, the Prudential building, the Duck tour and easily accessable to the Green LIne. I'm sure there are other frills that someone might miss here but we rarely are in our room when vacationing and all we ask is that its clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, adequate and safe”
Reviews.Author: jnsbradley
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 4 with 2 boys ages 9 and 12) stayed at the Midtown for 5 nights, June 8 - 13th. The hotel is very small in comparison to the many high rise hotels in Boston and may not be as modern, but it suited us very well. We arrived at about 9am on a Sunday....many guests were checking out. They promptly stored our bags in a locked room so that we could begin exploring Boston. I did notice that a few people were complaing about rates varying on nights of their bills and it sounded as though one complained of bugs and possibly rats......We had secured our rate of $179.00 per night for the duration of our trip well in advance and I had confirmed that in advance...as well as asking for a room toward the back of the hotel on the 2nd floor...(to cut down on the possibility of noise from the street) went to our room to check it out and rest a while by the very clean but very icy pool (the kids wouldn't even get in) Our room was one of the smaller one's (I think because we were a corner room) but was still very roomy for the 4 of us...very clean didn't smell. Sleeping in the room at night was fine...once we figured out the AC...it never gets very cold but was comfortable...we usually like it slightly cooler but not freezing if you like to be able to set it to very cool you won't be able to here....I didn't feel like the unit was noisy like other people had mentioned but the fan in the bathroom was (but that can be shut off) The staff was all very friendly to us but we never had a need to complain... Tha restaraunt was closed...they are charging for parking these days...cut less than other Boston hotels...We left late on our ast day to the airport, so the staff had locked up our bags again so that we could get one ast full day in Boston.... This is not as nice a hotel as others in Boston but very affordable.... checkout had been easy no surprises I did pay for the fridge $5 per night...my son has meds that need refridgerated....I had heard rates very from $300. - $500 per night (Celtics and the Red Sox in town)...we had reserved early so our $179. was a steal......There was a business traveler complaining that the wireless service wasn't so great... they were working on fixing his issue but I did notice that they had direct ethernet connections in the room if you wanted to bring a cable (they may have also had them available) We didn't want to bother with our laptops while traveling with the kids....so don't have a direct experience.. We used public transportation ....there are 2 T stations very close by and the Midtown is within walking distance of many great places to shop and eat. Overall accomodations are average....safe clean.....mattresses were comfortable pillows were new but cheap... not good for people who prefer a more firm pillow....house keeping was aways good... but if you are looking for frills and better AC go to Omni Parker House or the Collanade...just realize the price is Much higher....this is a GREAT VALUE!

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: rhood55
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The staff were friendly and it was very clean. However, the "motel" is just a made over Days Inn, and the makeover was rudimentary at best. We could hear every door shut all through the night. Televisions and conversations could be heard through the walls. The bathroom is tiny and the shower light cannot be turned on seperate of the vanity light which floods the bedroom area. Also, only a plexiglass partition (no door) between the vanity and rest of the room. So, you have to come out of the tiny shower dressed if privacy or modesty is an issue. We taped a Boston newspaper over the plexiglass. If you can swing one of the other hotels near the Prudential Center, do so. You'll be close to the train lines and have a much better stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For Family On Budget/Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SLCFamily
Reviews.Content: Our destination was Cooperstown, NY for a youth baseball tournament. My husband and I were traveling with our kids, ages 15 and 12. We flew into and out of Boston to see the Red Sox as part of our trip. I had read reviews on this website for various hotels and chose the Midtown from them. The reviews were right on and we were happy with the Midtown. Good price, plus a discount using AAA. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is older, but everything was clean and well kept. Our room was a good size. Parking underneath the hotel was reasonably priced and fairly secure. The location is great. Nice area, easy walking to the Prudential Center and Fenway Park. The subways are very close for farther desintations in the city, which we took several times. I would definitely recommend the Midtown for travelers on a budget, especially families going to see the Red Sox (note: do not buy grandstand seats if your family is tall!). I would not recommend this hotel to travelers looking for higher end accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pinkjimmychoos
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay if you're looking for somewhere in the Back Bay area. Close to transport links including both Back Bay station (fifteen minutes walk) and the subway (Symphony is the closest stop and about five minutes walk), this hotel is great if you're looking to save money and see all Boston has to offer. The only disadvantage is that there was no restaurant when we were there, so sadly the convenience of B&B was out, but it does benefit from being close to several restaurants and a mall, which all serve great breakfasts! Plus, a twenty minute walk takes you in the direction of the main shopping area and the common which has a lot of choice. The rooms are clean and decent sized and the staff on reception were friendly. If you want something wallet-friendly then I'd give this a shot- don't expect luxury but it certainly is quality.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are plain but clean”
Reviews.Author: eraclite
Reviews.Content: The hotel is plain but the rooms are big and clean and the price are low comparing with the other hotels in Boston. The location too is perfect, near the Prudential Center.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: mim22002
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about what the hotel would turn out like, considering some negative reviews, but was very happy with our stay, and would not hesitate to book this hotel again. We arrived quite early (before 2 pm) but there was no problem checking in at this time. The welcome at the front desk was extremely friendly. Check-in was quick and efficient. Our room was perfectly adequate for our requirements, clean and in good condition, with 2 double beds as requested, and shower/bath in good working order. We requested a non-smoking room and there was no smell of smoke in the room. We were not disturbed by noise during the night, apart from the occasional person in the corridor returning to their rooms, which you get in any hotel. Location was good, between Prudential and Symphony 'T' stations, and the nearby Prudential Centre was good for shopping and fast food/restaurants. Staff were without exception courteous and friendly, and we were genuinely sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Fine”
Reviews.Author: Blacktiger34
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights while we attended games at Fenway Park to see the Cardinals play. The room we stayed in was clean. The beds were comfortable. Read other reviews that complained of noise. We didn't hear or see anyone while we were there but I know that they had full occupancy based on traffic in lobby. If you are looking for a place simply to sleep, shower and shave then this is the place for you. If you are looking for something more fancy go somewhere else. For the price you can't beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “A few issues”
Reviews.Author: fulhamsupporter
Reviews.Content: The location is certainly OK, but my two night stay had a few issues. The AC in my room didn't work - it was a fan but the thermostat had broken long ago - and the Wifi at $9.95 a month didn't really work either, I had to stand by the door to get a signal. It's very hard to find a hotel in Boston for less than $200 a night these days but this is one of them, but you get what you pay for, at least in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JimandKathy
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed here during our two day stop in Boston. I was wondering what I would get after reading some of the reviews but what the heck. It is old and drab as they say but we found it clean and safe. ALL the staff we meet were great . I guess everyone has issues with something and at times it can just be bad luck. For the price and the location it can't be beat! Boston was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nam82nam
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel really couldn't be better - 5 minutes from the Prudential Centre and a metro stop. We stayed here for 2 nights and found the room comfortable and a good size. The room was a little dated but clean. My only complaint would be that the air conditioning is very noisy - you can hear the corridor one all the time. Saying this it certainly didn't keep me awake at night.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place”
Reviews.Author: Angus29
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location there is little to recommend about this hotel. Staff were surly (with the exception of the porter and the handyman). As stated in previous reviews the hotel is run down and dirty. Our room overlooked the main road and a bus parking area. The single glazed windows, which didn't shut properly, did little to keep out noise. Strange piped music came from the toilet extraction system during the night. No meals available, had to breakfast in a cafe one block down. Completely spoilt our visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “I was actually getting SCARED.”
Reviews.Author: guessy
Reviews.Content: This was an experience not to ever be forgotten. It was like something out of a horror movie. It has all the charm of an abandoned mental hospital- it's very drab, run down with scary looking stains in the hall carpets. It smells of urine on one floor and the second floor has an indescribable odor. The rooms were ok considering the type of place this is, but the service was horrific. I had gone with two other friends to see the Cure in concert. upon our return to the room at the end of the evening, we were in there 20 minutes talking when we were told to keep it down. No worries, we started talking in hushed tones. A while later, we were told to move to another room as we were again being too loud. Now I can understand if we were being loud, but we were talking just above a whisper. At this point, it was 2:20 in the morning. We were moved to a much smaller room on the second floor and it seems as though the people who had the room before us had a similar experience.... In the window, written in a white substance much like fake snow in a can at christmas was the word "Enjoy!!!" (I saw the view in the morning, there was barbed wire on top of the fence outside our window- nice touch) We had complained to the manager, but the person who told us we had to move, denied ever saying so claiming instead that at 2:20 in the morning, we had ASKED to be uprooted in our pajamas and crammed into a closet sized room. I am a 30 something year old who is well educated and well traveled. I've NEVER been subjected to an experience like this before- it was downright CREEPY.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but terrible rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: claudandlucy
Reviews.Content: There is no heat in the hotel, they have turned it off for the season. They think that is acceptable. They are operating the hotel with rooms below 60 degrees and are doing nothing. The hotel is in a good location and that is it. It is poorly maintained, poorly operated and without a doubt the worst room I have ever stayed in. I am writing the review from my room, I am under 3 blankets because it is so cold in the room. I called the front desk and there responce was that the heat is off for the season. It is below 60 degrees in my room and they are making no attempt to address the issue other than bringing us more blankets. If your considering this place in the spring or fall, you are in for a suprise. IF YOU HAVE ANOTHER OPTION, CHOSE IT, I JUST WANT YOU TO AVOID THE SAME BS WE ARE IN.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: walkingtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Midtown Hotel's best feature was its location. It was walking distance to downtown Boston, and just a few blocks from the New England Conservatory of Music and the Museum of Fine Arts. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. While it was not the most up-to-date building, it was in good condition. The only downsides were that the drain in our shower did not work, and the rooms seemed to be separated by just wallpaper; it was rather noisy. However, we would return to this hotel. Our overall experience was very good.

Reviews.Title: “in need of major renovation”
Reviews.Author: esg-nyc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clearly in need of renovation and a more honest listings on hotel sites. When I checked in, I opened the window in my room only to find that it was broken and could not be closed. When I told the manager, he offered to have someone come up in a few hours and close it. When I pointed out to him that I intended to open and close the window a number of times and that I would like to be moved to a room with a working window he said "it's an old hotel, All the windows are broken" and he was right. The mechanism that cranked the window open and closed, on every window in the 5 other rooms they showed me was damaged, the window would open, but closing it was nearly impossible. In all but one, the bathroom vent was also broken. I was also a bit surprised as the thumbnail photo of the hotel on the hotels.com listing does not actually show the hotel. The images imply a large building, not the old, poorly maintained two story structure that is the hotel. The hotel summary also mis-states its distance from other locations, for example: the listing says One block from Copley Place, when in fact it is two full stops on mass transit away. I felt totally lied to and ripped off by my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain”
Reviews.Author: havecardwilltravel
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, great location, clean room, comfortable beds. Close to the T and Prudential Center. Ate breakfast at Thorton's restaurant. Parking only $14.00. Given parking extension without charge second day so I could go to the Science Museum for the day before returning home. You can walk to Fenway for a tour. Will return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent inexpensive family place”
Reviews.Author: Timmycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed from Dec 27-Jan1, chose bec. of reviews on this site. As with another poster, first impression was Oh Dear (very 50s/60s lobby & dreary but new gray paint on corridor walls) but our room was clean, security guy very evident esp. late at night, and wonderfully helpful cheerful staff changed that impression quickly. It's actually an old motor court type building, with cars corralled in the central courtyard -- ours slept there for $14/night. Beat that elsewhere in the city! The first floor is nonsmoking (what we wanted) & these rooms are partially over this car court, so the floor was cold when we got in--but things warmed up when we turned on the heat. Do bring slippers or flip flops. The heat is air, not baseboard, and it blows in noisily unless you turn the blower very low, and the heat up--separate controls. The trick about the noise is turning the blower low. The TV was dismal ---small screen, & several channels very staticky esp the Weather Channel the one we really wanted! However, we had not come to Boston to sit in the hotel & watch TV! So it didn't really bother us. We paid $99/night the week between Christmas & New Years, so we have no complaints. The things we really wanted were cleanliness, safety & near to the T & we got those. We have stayed at 4 & 5 star hotels that were not as clean & had less pleasant staff. The rooms are huge by city hotel standards. Lots of room for families to spread out or for you to place your purchases if you are on a shopping expedition. The price allowed us to place more of our budget in enjoyments such as the ballet. Our room appeared to have been redone recently---new dark green patterned carpet & new looking fabric on chairs, also Craftsman style headboards. There is a coffee maker & the little packets are replenished daily. Corian sink top was generously sized for placing toiletries & not getting them soaked. Sink is separated by pocket door from shower/toilet, and shower section has shelves above toilet for towels/clothes. However, the fan & lights are together which means the rather noisy bathrooom fan went on whenever you used anything---that I did find irritating. On New Years Eve we did hear some guests going up & down the hall, but they weren't that bad & it only lasted a few minutes----and what else do we expect on New Years Eve? We did not ever hear our neighbors in rooms to either side at all. There was a sign saying the in house restaurant is closed for renovations. The desk clerk also mentioned that some of the rooms in the smoking section, on the second floor, are being redone. The guest who had checked in just before us came right back to say his room smelled smoky, and they sent someone there to spray it with something that looked like a can of Lysol. This was a nosmoking room---I want to know why, oh why, do smokers smoke in nonsmoking rooms. There are people who request those rooms because they have asthma and the lingering smoke will trigger an attack of their disease---they aren't being snooty about your smoke; they just don't want to wind up in the hospital during their trip! Maybe all hotels should take Marriott's step & ban all smoking period. There is internet connection in the lobby; we saw people using it. Our trip was pleasure only & we did not bring the laptop so I can't address the connections. There is a T stop at Symphony, half block west, and another one block east at Prudential. Towards Pru less than a block a cafe, Thornton's, with really excellent breakfasts & lunches. The Prudential center is across the street & down the block. In the Pru center, there is a St Francis Chapel on the ground floor & we were able to go to Mass on Sunday morning. There is an Au Bon Pain right across from the chapel so you can go there for a bite after church if desired. We wanted to watch the Pats/Giants game with others & had a teen with us, so she could not be in a pub or sports bar after 8 pm. We learned there is an Uno restaurant right up Huntington Ave past & across from Symphony Hall. It has loads of TVs & being a restaurant the underage can be there well into the night. It's on the same side of street as the Midtown. We would go back to this hotel in a minute---while it is very simple in decor, the very affordable price & the excellent location, cleanliness & lovely staff made it the right choice for us. It is right between the museums we wanted to visit & the downtown things, and also has easy access to the Mass Pike to get in & out of town when we visited relatives in the burbs.

Reviews.Title: “Bad soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: TheHighrise
Reviews.Content: I was delighted to find such a reasonably priced hotel in Boston, and had high hopes for my stay. Check-in was friendly and efficient and I was assigned a room at the back of the building. The first night was fine (mainly due to jetlag!) but I began to notice the noise on the second day; my neighbours (a dad with two children) spent all evening shouting and running about in their room. The noise went on until about 3am at which point I may have banged on the wall! That morning I complained to the very helpful Ron at reception, who moved me to another room. After a couple of nights of (relatively) uninterrupted sleep, the New Year's revellers began to trickle in and the noise became unbearable. The rooms are badly soundproofed (I could hear my neighbour's ablutions!) and the doors slam. It was also a shame that the restaurant was closed, as that was another reason for my choosing the Midtown. On the whole, a good, clean hotel - friendly staff, but if you want a good night's sleep you may be out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Midtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irishdancer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Midtown from 25th -30th October. Midtown is a lovely clean hotel quite big lots of corridors. Very clean bathroom, beds made everyday. Seperate washbasin. Plenty of hanging space and drawers. Coffee machine in the room, with replacement of tea/coffee daily. Clean towels daily. The reception staff are extremely friendly. and spoke everytime we entered the hotel. Midtown is directly opposite the Christian Scientist Church (beautiful building). Quite a few people think the Midtown is not central but I personally think its very easy to get to . Prudential Centre is a 2 minuite walk away the T is underneath the Centre. Lots of lovely shops. Thorntons Restaurant is a few doors away and they do great breakfasts (Yum).. The only downside is that it is on a main road and can be quite noisy at times. When we stayed the Red Sox had won the world series and decided that they were going to hold a parade a 2AM in the morning!!!!! (An impromptu parade) so we were up all night then. It is good for singles and families alike.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: cxp
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for a convention I went to at the Convention Center and the Sheraton Boston. The room was nothing special, was clean, but no pictures or decorations. The staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tamfoxy
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for one night OK but a bit far out for our liking.Room was large but very bland.As we were only staying for one night we didn't have much contact with the staff but they seemed quite friendly.If we went to Boston again we would look for somewhere a bit closer to the centre and with a bit more atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very well priced and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: prhuk
Reviews.Content: This was easily the cheapest hotel we could find that was in Boston central (well, Back Bay but not far from the centre). A short walk to the underground it was very very well positioned for a budget hotel. We were given a huge room which was a little bland but was nevertheless clean and well maintained. There was no gym but the YMCA was a short walk away and was cheap with a day rate. This was a very reasonable hotel in every way and we were very pleased with it as a good budget experience. The receptionists were really welcoming and friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, location, and price!”
Reviews.Author: Pennsylvaniagirl28
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of checking when trying to find a hotel in Boston. The Midtown had the best price, and I received a AAA discount. Also, parking at any hotel is extremely expensive ($35.00 a night on average). The Midtown had the best price at $14.00 per night in a safe underground location right below the hotel. We didn't need use the car once!! Location of the Midtown was very good. We weren't right in the center of the city, but were close to many things. We saw a Red Sox game at Fenway and were within walking distance. We were very close to the Prudential Center where there is a mall and lots of shops and stores and restaurants. Also, very close to the subway, which we took to the North End for a fabulous dinner. There is a great little restaurant next door called Thorton's where we had breakfast twice. The staff at the hotel was friendly and accomodating. Although the hotel is a little on the older side, our king size room had new furniture and a very comfortable bed. The room was pretty big. Our room did face the main road (Huntington Ave.), but at night it was quiet and we did not hear any street noise. There was even a concierge who we asked a lot of questions to and we were given great advice. We even booked a trolley tour at a discounted price that picked you up one block from the hotel and looped around the entire city. It was great. All in all, I'd say this hotel is definetely worthwhile to stay at. It offers a great price and location. It's not as fancy as a Hilton or Radisson may be, but it was clean, comfortable and affordable. Recommended with flying colors!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Value”
Reviews.Author: PaulTravels
Reviews.Content: Our daughter is entering Northeastern U (NEU) as a freshman in September 07 so my wife, daughter and I stayed at the Midtown Hotel in July for NEU orientation. This hotel is two blocks from Northeastern. I have written and read many Trip Advisor reviews and the common thread I have found is that if a person perceives they received â€œgood valueâ€� for their money, they are generally satisfied. â€œGood Valueâ€� characterizes the Midtown. At every step we received a higher level of service, a cleaner larger room, higher level of attention from staff, and better overall location then we expected. For what we paid, which was less then half the price of the major chain/boutique hotels within Â¼ mile of this hotel, we were very satisfied. That said, I would be hesitant to recommend this hotel whole hearted to a friend because it is a some what Spartan hotel. On the other hand, we quickly tried to get a room in this hotel for parentâ€™s weekend in October and it was sold out. So we certainly would consider this hotel againâ€”definitely---as well as many others it seems. The surroundings are safe, very easy walk to the Pru Center, Newberry, longer but very doable walk to Fenway, and for Northeastern, canâ€™t be beat.
