Car parking is directly below the hotel for an additional $14/night. Here are many, many shops and eateries in the locale. If I were doing a comparison between this hotel and a national chain I would compare it to a well run Days Inn. If you can get a room in the Midtown Hotel, give it a try----donâ€™t expect the Ritz, or the lobby glitz of a Marriott or Hyatt, but you will be happy with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dandelion1906
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I checked in at the Midtown Hotel on June the 21st 2007 for 4 nights. We were met at the door by a porter who carried our luggage to the reception and waited while we checked in. We had booked a single room each and were amazed, when we saw the size of them. My daughters was a double room and mine was a king sized room. The rooms were spotless as was the rest of the hotel. The area is lovely and within walking distance to the Prudential Tower and Boston Common, where you can follow the Freedom Trail to all the other attractions. We would definately stay at this hotel again, I cannot find fault with it. The same goes for the Hotel staff, who were friendly and helpful. Well done to the Midtown Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better”
Reviews.Author: coto2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a brief trip to Boston and stayed at the Midtown for one Saturday night. We chose it after reading reviews here that suggested it if you were going to a game at Fenway due to it's proximity to the park and low parking rates. If your primary focus is to be close to Fenway and pay relatively little to park and you don't care much about the actual hotel experience, this will work for you. On the other hand, I wouldn't recommend it if you are at all looking for a nice, comfortable, quiet and well managed hotel. Everything about it feels budget and truly, it's just a motel that they plunked down in the middle of the city. There's nothing horrendous to report, just a lot of annoying issues with the room and the overall accomadations. We were very glad to move on from the Midtown and stay at the Commonwealth which is also very near Fenway, but a quantum leap in experience. Yes, it's more expensive, but in the case of the Midtown Hotel, you definitely get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but has some issues”
Reviews.Author: HandyguyNY
Reviews.Content: Good news first: the room was clean, relatively large for Boston, and the bed was comfortable. This may be enough for many visitors. The most serious problem for me was that windows on ground-floor rooms open right onto the sidewalk in the middle of the city. No bars or other security devices between you and a prowler. And plenty of loud traffic noise. And when I was there, the air conditioning was not working, so without the windows open it was uncomfortably stuffy. The front desk said to me when I mentioned this on checkout: "Yeah, a lot of people complained it was too cold, so we turned the A/C off. Now everyone's complaining it's hot." Apparently not the most modern of heating systems! Also: no accessible electrical outlets for recharging your phone or iPod. Terrible, small, old TV. Embarrassingly cheapo furniture, other than the bed. Towels were fair but soap and shampoo were meager and motel-ish. Much higher rates on the weekend than on weeknights, so their trade is mostly tourists rather than business. I stayed there for a convention because the Sheraton was sold out. I'll keep looking next time.

Reviews.Title: “central and basic”
Reviews.Author: Eire26
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in the Midtown for 4 nites. Our visit to Boston was mainly for shopping. The Midtown is located beside the T line. The prudential centre is only a 10 min walk from the Hotel. The room was very big which allowed for the many shopping bags. our rooms were clened every day and we got cleans towels also. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The staff also arranged transpot for us to Wrentham Village and back to the airport. My only critiscism would be that there is no restaurant/bar or cafe in the hotel, but there is a litle cafe beside the hotel(at the T). All in all the hotel was a good choice although it was not the luxury of the Marriot up the street. Would highly recommend it for those who go for the shoppin!!

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 2stpddogz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the midtown for an extended weekend. Recommended by a local college student because of the cheap parking fee. Not being from the area we were not familiar with the parking fees charged in Boston. The midtown had the cheapest parking.. The hotel is more like a motel in the middle of the city. We spend most of our time out about town only sleeping in our room .. Clean and close to T stations and shopping.. Nothing luxury about the hotel. If affordable and clean and location is what you are looking for midtown hotel is it..

Reviews.Title: “What's with all the NOISE!?”
Reviews.Author: scottish_sightseer
Reviews.Content: Just thought I'd give a summary of the recent stay my wife and I had in the Midtown Hotel, Boston. Initial impressions of the place were good. Ron at the reception desk was very friendly, and our check-in was handled in a matter of seconds. An equally affable porter offered to take our bags to the room, which was number 172. The room was huge; two double beds, a desk, small table and seating area, plus a good sized bathroom with bath and shower. The facilities were good too - nice TV with plenty of channels, and a funky little cafetiere for making fresh coffee. Everything was very clean, though the decor was slightly dated, and the bathroom suite showed some signs of age. I'm not one to pick at such things, however, so all in all we were happy. Being somewhat jet-lagged, we decided a short nap was in order. Sadly, I didn't get a wink of sleep. No sooner had we settled down, we were subjected to an ongoing cacophony of slamming, shouting, and what sounded like the practising of an inexperienced drummer. The noise irritated me somewhat, but given that this was still only late afternoon, I wasnâ€™t too bothered. Our siesta having been abandoned, we decided to explore a little. The location of the hotel was very good. The immense Prudential shopping centre was just a couple minutes walk away, and had a subway stop to get wherever we should want. Massachusetts Avenue, with its assorted shops and restaurants, was only a few minutes walk in the opposite direction. So, having been fed and watered, we returned to the hotel for a well-deserved (and by then long overdue) nightâ€™s sleep. Unfortunately, once again I found sleep hard to come by. It seems that the noise of the Midtown hotel persists at all hours of day and night. Doors slamming, voices shouting, and a variety of crashes, bangs and wallops - all conspired to rob me of a restful slumber. After two such disturbed nights, we did complain to reception, who said they could only help us if we were able to tell them which rooms, specifically, the noises were coming from. Not wanting to wander around the hotel in our pyjamas in search of the parties responsible, we decided just to grin and bear it. In time, we got used to the constant racket, but felt annoyed that weâ€™d ever had to. In summary, I was a bit disappointed by the Midtown. The room was large, comfortable, and reasonably well-equipped, while the location was very good. However, the ongoing noise of the place â€“ and the staffâ€™s apparent unwillingness to help â€“ put me off, and means that if I do ever return to Boston, it is unlikely I will rest my head at the Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “ch ch ch check it out!”
Reviews.Author: BigJaydog
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, spacious room and it appears the hotel is under a refurb so the summer might be a great time to go. Staff were friendly and the price was reasonable considering you are in the same vicinity as the Hilton and the Sheraton. Very close to the Cheesecake Factory which is great but not if you're watching the waistline.

Reviews.Title: “great central location”
Reviews.Author: soarfoot
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed at this Hotel at the beginning of December while doing some Christmas shopping. I had never been to Boston before and did not realise how local and compact it was. The Midtown Hotel is the ideal location to base yourself from and it is definately value for money. We walked everywhere and were just across the street from the famous cheesecake factory restaurant which we couldn't fault. The rooms were modern and very clean. My only worry was the connecting door to another room but thats my only bad point. The staff at the desk were very helpful and we booked our bus to Wrythem village from here. We were collected from the door and dropped back in the evening. I would have no problems in recommending this Hotel to anyone. Boston is a great city with great bars and restaurants and great shopping. Will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: Scottishperson
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for four nights from November 9th, and found the hotel to be very central to everything. The staff were very very friendly, and nothing was too much bother. The room we had was huge, two double beds, tv, en-suite bathroom, ground floor and lovely and warm. Our room was to the back of the hotel. We did not need car parking. We got a taxi from the airport and we asked if it was a set fare, but the guy running the taxi stance said no, it was metered. We got in and the taxi driver talked all the way, asking us where we came from etc, and we then noticed the meter was not on, so we just left it. He asked us to telephone on the day we were leaving and he would come for us. We asked the price and he said $28.00, so we gave him $40, a tip of $12, as he was so nice. When we were leaving we did not bother to phone him as we thought we would just hail a taxi outside, so we did just that only to find out this taxi had the meter on and it came to $20.40 even although we were stuck in traffic (5pm)!!! The guy coming had conned us and into the bargain we had given him the extra. If you are getting a taxi from the airport, check that the meter is on and dont be conned. Anyway, back to the hotel, the Prudential centre is 2 minutes from the hotel, and it had lots of shops, food terrace, restaurants etc. The Cheesecake Factory is also in this builiding and for anyone not from the US, they have gorgeous cheesecakes, but they also do delicous food and cocktails. Open from 11.30 am until 11.30pm S-T, and 12.30 on a Friday and Saturday. We ate here twice. The portions are huge, and 1 piece of cheesecake is enough for two, and if you leave any food they automatically ask if you want to have it wrapped!!! I also bought a $10 phone card and I used it in the hotel room, which is great, and they only charge 50cents for letting you use the phone. My card let me have four conversations on land lines in the UK, from 20-30 minutes EACH, then a mobile in the UK for 20 minutes, and I still had time left on the card when I left!!! We like our breakfasts so we found the Marriott Hotel on the same side as the hotel further up the road (about 5 minutes walk) go up the escalator and you will see the breakfast room, they do a menu, or we had the buffet breakfast which was marvellous for the money. First day we had, oatmeal (like porridge), FRESH orange juice, coffee or tea, french toast with strawberries, pineapple and oranges, and maple syrup, and a blueberry muffin. There is LOTS to choose from. We thought the buffet was $18.95, but when the waitress saw we did not have anything cooked (sausage, bacon etc), she said it was only $13.95. Great value for money. You can eat as much as you like. We also had a meal at Legal Seafood in the Prudential Centre, but I would suggest booking on a Friday or saturday, which the hotel did for us. If you want shopping in one place with lots of bargains in the stores, we got the T to Kendal (about 10 minutes over the Charles river) $1.25 each way, and then there is a courtesy bus at the bus stop 4 times an hour, to take you to the Galleria (5 minutes), open until 9.30pm. Shops include, Macys, Saks, Old Navy, Sears, Best Buy, Ann Taylor, Benetton, H&M, Victoria's Secret, Abercrombie & Fitch, Banana Republic, Timberland, Book shops, Toy shops, Banks,Shoe shops, in fact they have everything. They also have a food terrace, which had every kind of fast food. The Cheesecake factory is here also. the reason we went here was for Old Navy as this is the only one in Boston. I would definately stay at the Midtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: junesun911
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel with a couple of girlfriends for the weekend. Toured around boston. The midtown is a great location, one block from the T (Subway) or else u can walk 2 blocks down and one block over to the PRUDENTIAL CENTER which is a mall and a T station underneath. Hotel was clean and felt safe. Parking is cheap (you have to pay for parking all over boston!!) duck tours takes off from THE PRUDENTAL center, so we were able 2 get there early and catch the 2nd tour out (cause they sell out very fast). There is no frills in this hotel, good price, good location, clean. Internet you have to pay for :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A&YJ
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated just where you want a Hotel to be! The sights and centre of Boston are but moments away. We stayed at the Hotel last week and were very, very comfortable there. The staff were all friendly and efficient, our room was clean and comfortable, and if you require assisatnce then nothing is too much trouble. Next time we are in Boston, then we shall be staying here. A & Y Johnson UK

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: NJGIRL
Reviews.Content: The Midtown Hotel is just what it should be. Basic, clean, quiet, and cheap. With many Boston hotels averaging $250 per night, we had a perfectly acceptable king-size room for just under $100 including parking. Don't expect the Ritz but it's just fine for those of us who only want a clean, comfortable room, a bathroom that works, acceptable sound-proofing, and a staff that is helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: saraquails
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Midtwon with a friend for a two night stay and I was very satisfied with my choice. The room we stayed in was very spacious, with two large queen beds, a big TV, a nice dresser with a big mirror, a table with two chairs and a big wardrobe. The bathroom was good enough:pretty small with a bathtub but very very clean and with loads of fresh towels everyday. In the room we also found a long list of restaurants from where we could order in. The staff at the Midtown was friendly enough and very helpful. One of our suitcases got lost at the airport and the guy at the reception desk offered many times to call British Airways to help us locate it, and when it finally arrived at the hotel they brought it directly to our room. The location of the Midtown is very good, it's just in front of the Scientist Church (which I think is beautiful!) and a few steps from Prudential Center, where there are many shops and restaurants (Top of the Hub...very posh!). There are two T stops (subway) really only a couple of minutes away (even though I have to say that the trains are not many and that we pretty always waited a few good minutes to get on one!). The Museum of Fine Arts is within walking distance (10 minutes tops!) and so is Copley Square. Although the actual city centre (around Fenueil Hall) is quite distant if you're walking from the Midtown, it's only about 3 or 4 T stops away, and even if you have to wait a little for the train to arrive it never takes more than 20 minutes! I will defintely stay there again next time I'll visit Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Midtown”
Reviews.Author: bOOleansVarKK
Reviews.Content: We just arived home this evening, we has a fantastic stay at the Midtown. My husband and I are over 30 grad students, so we have standards, but not a lot of money. Our stay at Midtown was really great! The decore is late 90's, but rooms are very clean and the staff is extremely helpful! Things that I wanted during my stay: 1.) Glass tumblers - I prefer drinking water out of Glas rather than plastic. 2.) Computer access - The Midtown does offer free wireless service, but I choose not to travel with my computer. I would have liked the ablity to use a computer at the hotel (i.e to print out my boarding passes, rather than go to Kinkos! I would stay at this hotel again and highly recommend that this is a good value, for a great price (oh, I booked with Expedia). Oh Lastlty - the name is a reflection on it's location - it really is in the middle of everything - even located between 2 "T" stops!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: vter
Reviews.Content: Since we were driving in from Vermont we were looking for a hotel with parking and someone recommeded the Midtown as there is free parking. Parking is located under the hotel. Location is great - we were able to walk to/fro Fenway Park for the baseball game we were in town attending. It's a quick walk to Copley Place and the Prudential Center for shops & restaurants. A T stop is just up the street from the hotel. The hotel itself is an older low-rise motor inn type place. Looks really out of place! The room we had was fairly large and was clean. The decor was definately outdated (if thats important to you) and I agree with an above poster that the mattress was a bit too soft & lumpy. But, for $179 per night with free parking, I'm not complaining! Definately a best bet in Boston if you're trying to watch your dollars. We'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but a tired room.”
Reviews.Author: Yorks-27
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a very good position and was very handy for the main attractions in Boston. The staff are very friendly also. Our main complaint was the room with the hairdyer not working, shower head hanging of the wall. Air conditioning was noisy and smelly and the mattress was very soft. Overall the hotel is in need of some updating but if you do not mind the above then it is ideal to explore all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyCanadian
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. I was on vacation with a friend and we were easily able to walk to restaurants, shops, and to see the sites. In my research of Boston this hotel combined the best location with the best price - not that it was inexpensive. The other close hotels seemed priced at 250+ and I paid under 200 including tax. The hotel was clean (though old and a bit run down) and the staff were really nice. I would not say it is a top of the line hotel but if you are looking to stay at a good location in the city and are not super picky this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mid Town, mid price, good value”
Reviews.Author: rockscorpion
Reviews.Content: My wife and I used this hotel in late June for an overnight stay before travelling to Northren Vermont. Fulfilled our requirments and it's location near the Coply/Prudential centres was ideal for our short stay. Rooms clean, beds comfortable. Room faced the street and we were not disturbed by noise. Hotel staff were excellent. We would use it again when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price & location”
Reviews.Author: gotthemeyes
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went to Boston for a concert @ Fenway, and I was pleasantly surprised how clean it was, and what a great location. It was inexpensive for Boston, and I wasn't expecting much. It was a very short walk to Fenway and to the T, since you do NOT want to drive around Boston! If you are looking for fancy, do not stay here - but if you are looking for clean, inexpensive way to stay in Boston, try it.

Reviews.Title: “Good covenient location; Bad night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Travlin'Bug
Reviews.Content: PROS: We stayed at the Midtown three nights the weekend prior to 4th of July. I agree that the location is good if you are going to Fenway, Copley Place, Prudential Center, or the Symphony... when you get off the Symphony T-stop the hotel is right there, and you can walk to all of the above on a nice day, or make us of the T-stops. We still needed the T to get us to Freedom Trail/Boston Commons & the New England Aquarium... would've been quite a long walk for the kids. There are plenty of restaurants a short distance to Prudential, and the concierge is helpful & knowledgable. The rooms were very clean & a decent size for the price. Parking is Free... a big plus if you have to bring a car... probably the biggest reason to justify staying here (saves you $20-30 per night elsewhere). CONS: The beds in our room were very unconfortable... noisy/creaky, very springy with every toss & turn, & you feel like you lean to the middle. Our son decided it was more comfortable on a pallet on the floor. The buiding is old (but neat & clean) & the floors seem hollow & walls thin... we had noisy teens above us & you could hear every slam of their connecting doors, each step as they ran & jumped across the floors, & talking & laughing all night. They had fun... we didn't sleep. We were on the first floor, so if we returned we only want a top floor room. Management did talk to them about the noise on our 2nd request at 1:30 a.m., so at least the jumping around stopped. This was our worst sleeping experience in a hotel...and we were really only there to sleep & shower... we were out enjoying the city all day long. For the price, next time we'd probably stay further out & just ride the T into town... we value a good nights sleep after walking the city all day.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: WI_travel12
Reviews.Content: The Midtown was fine for just a couple nights with our children. Location was good - walking distance to Fenway & T stops. Front desk was helpful & a tour desk is also located in the lobby. The building is obviously old but they have done some remodeling - updated bathrooms, carpeting, etc. We actually stayed in two different rooms because we had an unwelcome "critter" in our room the first night. Managment addressed situation immediately and we were ultimately satisfied with their compensation. Our first room overlooked the parking lot (Free Parking by the way - big plus) -- the second was facing the street. The noise from traffic & people walking by was quite loud and that was difficult with our young children. Outdoor pool was fine - decent temperature, towels were provided, clean & attendant was on duty. Although Breakfast is Not included, the Cafe does offer a large menu for breakfast & prices and service were good. Overall - OK price for a decent locaton -- but we'll probably try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem for Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: Merrimack_N_H_Roadie
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting too much, based on prior reviews, but were pleasantly surprised! My husband and I were in town for two days, mainly to see a Red Sox game. We decided to make a real visit of it and came in through the subway, which very conveniently had a stop so close to the Midtown Hotel that we could see it from the street as soon as we exited the subway! Though by no means a fancy hotel, I thought the hotel was well worth the money. The Prudential is one block away, offering budget priced, delicious food. We walked to Fenway Park-it was that close. After the game, I was disapointed there were no restaurants close to the hotel still open, but the front desk clerk advised that there was a pizza place open until 12:30 a.m., only 3 blocks from the hotel. He had recommended Boston House of Pizza, but being tired, we missed it, and went into the tiny pizza place right next to B.H.O.P. instead, and were glad we did. The atmosphere was nothing, but the pizza was excellent and very reasonably priced. Although I mostly agree with the reviews concerning the furniture, I did not find the accommodations as run down as suggested, nor did I expect much better, considering the price of the other hotels in the same vicinity. Bonus-the rooms are very large. If you cannot afford the Ritz, and we certainly can't, this hotel is well worth the price tag-and the location cannot be beat! We either walked to most places in Boston, or took the subway to the more distant spots, with the subway entrance right at the Prudential. The outdoor pool was quite nice, with lounge chairs all around. I did walk into the hotel restaurant, but decided not to try the food as it was miserably hot in there-and no air conditioning-or it wasn't turned on. Only 2 small problems-at 6:00 a.m. it was not possible to get really hot water, only warm, and the first floor ice machine was broken the whole time we were there. These were not huge problems, though, only annoyances. The hotel concierge was very knowledgeable and directed our trips on the subway perfectly. He could even tell me if there was a local Dunkin Donuts and when it opened, something I greatly appreciated! Overall, it is not the Ritz, but I feel the very reasonable room rate and awesome location more than make up for a lack of luxury! We plan on returning to Boston soon and will definitely stay at the Midtown again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights here on our first visit to this wonderful city. The location is perfect and free parking in downtown Boston is fantastic. Have to agree with a previous reviewer that you need to ask for a room at the back of the property - the road at the front is VERY noisy. The rooms were well cleaned daily, the linen and towels changed and the knowledgeable and friendly lobby porter(s) were more than happy to impart their advice. Don't get me wrong, this hotel is not Holiday Inn standard, but for a budget hotel within 5 mins walk of the Prudential Centre and with a T-stop and Duck Tour stop virtually outside the door, it is a really good value-for-money Boston property.

Reviews.Title: “If it had a makeover it would be great!”
Reviews.Author: racitonleroy
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself gave us no complaints nor did it give us anything to rave about. With a "makeover" it would be really cute - however, the cheap early 80's furniture and the didgy appearance of the common areas would turn a lot of people off. The rooms themselves are very spacious - with a couch and dinning table ( although neither was comfortable or very good quality - even for a hotel! ). Our bed was not the most comfortable - but nor were many other beds in our 10 week trip! The staff were quite polite and willing to assist - and a bonus was being able to book tour tickets and be picked up and dropped off at the hotel door! The location was really good and lets face it...you are there to see the city or whatever, not to stay in a hotel room the whole time! It was an easy walk to the Prudential Centre and Newberry St with all the shopping and dining options you could ask for. And the FREE PARKING was a real bonus - considering that this is a more reasonably priced hotel. I would recommend this hotel to others - but with a warning that the decor is dated and not the best quality. So if you plan to only sleep and shower there - I would stay there and spend your money on a nice meal or shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Call to confirm your room requests ahead of time!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia, and requested a non-smoking room. When I checked in, the manager on duty said to me, "Unfortunately, we don't have any non-smoking rooms available." I hadn't mentioned anything to him about it, so I figured he must have seen my reservation request. I said, "but I specifically requested a non-smoking room", and he said, "yes, and we try to honor those requests, but we can't guarantee them if people check in before you who have also requested non-smoking." Later, as he was finishing my paperwork, he said, "Again, I'm sorry, we just didn't get your request from Expedia. If we had gotten it, we would have honored it." Now I was pissed...because this was a flat-out lie. He obviously forgot that he was the one who first brought up the subject, and that the only way he could have known I wanted non-smoking, is because he saw it on the reservation request. The best he could do was offer to move me to a non-smoking room for our second night. Smoking room: it was terrible. It not only smelled heavily of stale smoke, but also of stale urine (even my husband, a former smoker couldn't stand it). The room decor was old and like a cheap motel (for example, the tv wasn't inside a wooden armoire, but was perched on top of a pole that was screwed into the floor.) I had to put a t-shirt over my pillow just to sleep because the pillow stank of smoke. I kept waking up coughing because of the condition of the room. Thankfully, the next night we were moved to a non-smoking room. Non-smoking room: This room was a completely different class of room, and was more like what I was expecting from the internet pictures. It was newer, had nice dark furniture (tv was inside of an armoire), it was bigger, clean, it smelled fresh, and was a great deal. If I could have stayed in this room for the entire stay, and had never seen that other room, I would have rated this hotel above average. The place really is in a nice location (walking distance to prudential center, the T, and great restaurants/shopping), and you can't beat having free parking in downtown Boston! The price is really excellent, but before staying there again, I would call and confirm any and all room requests, or else you might get stuck in that pit of a room we had.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing ..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Smelly hotel. Smelly and unclean. Staff member is unhelpful. If i can do it again, i would stay the many hotels near by.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great! The rest?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of the Midtown was AWESOME. Close to Fenway, The Prudential Center, many restaurants, and much more. The room looked nothing like the pictures posted on this or their website. The window in our room was broken. I couldn't open or close it ,t was stuck open. Therefore extremely loud in the morning. Traffic was too loud for me. Lastly, everytime someone around us closed their door, you could hear it bang shut. You get what you pay for. Other hotels near there are much more.

Reviews.Title: “Life in a dormitory”
Reviews.Author: Nedzer
Reviews.Content: I stayed four night here in early April, 2006. The atmosphere was very institutional. The hallways and common areas were tired and dingy. It was depressing to enter into the hotel. It was like a bad college dorm. That said, my room was clean and reasonably spacious. As long as I stayed in the room and out of the common areas, I had no major complaints. In the case of this hotel, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “simple and clean”
Reviews.Author: angelbyus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my 14 year old daughter to visit my other daughter at Northeastern University.The staff was great / check in was a breeze. the room was nice and clean. the bathroom was a little small ,but clean. you can't beat the free parking . would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Delivers as a well-located basic, budget accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: DaveH-ExPat
Reviews.Content: I needed a cheap place to stay in the downtown Boston for a night, and took this off of Expedia. I did not expect luxury, nor does the hotel provide more than a clean, quiet room. But if that is the bargain that you want to make, then this hotel delivers well. The hotel is located on the south side of the river, just south of the big Christian Science complex. It is within convenient walking distance of the T, and there are lots of stores in the area that can provide fast food, perscription meds, hardware, and small electronics. The cab in from the airport had trouble finding the street address at ten at night, so print a map before you come. The staff is friendly and efficient: the concierge / porter in particular never failed to ask if I needed directions to where I was going. The room was huge (about 2X the size of a normal hotel room) but sparsely furnished and dark. I was on the back, away from the street, and it was reasonably quiet and free of glare from adjacent buildings and streets. No elevators, and dark hallways with a maze of room directions: make sure you know where you are going before you leave the desk. The bathroom was small but clean, hot water and pressure was good.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: beachlovers17
Reviews.Content: Great location, free parking, very helpful and nice staff. The coffee shop made a great breakfast with good coffee. Nothing fancy - Bed and pillows were ok - everything was clean. Would certainly stay here again. And if you're looking by chance for a Catholic Church, there's one two blocks away in Prudential Center (a big mall) Subway is also a block away. We arrived at 5:25 pm and were in our room by 5:30. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Would have bee okay except for the mouse and the glue traps”
Reviews.Author: AllanB
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. I got in at 10:30pm and there were glue traps in the room. Being tired and hungry, I found a pizza place, then walked over to the Sheraton and Hilton across the street to see if I could book a room. $299 and $349 were a bit steeep, so I head back to my room at Midtown and the glue traps are magically gone. Well, this is a surprise as I had the Please Do Not Disturb thingy on the door. Next morning I head off to Linux World Expo, have dinner with a friend and head back to the hotel. About an hour later oy little friend the mouse, scampers across the room. Okay, the location is great. Right near a subway, easy to walk downtown or Fenway if you're into walking, but I'm staying someplace else next year.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok to stay here”
Reviews.Author: LondonParisRomeLover
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, but reasonably clean, decent rooms, much cheaper than any other of the surrounding hotels. Free parking is a big bonus, but the ceiling entering the garage is low! Make sure you didn't tie anything to the roof of your car! This is a good place if you are visiting Boston to check out colleges, or visiting someone going to school in Boston. Very convenient to all the sites and colleges. Safe. Not much to eat in the hotel, but you can easily walk anywhere nearby for a meal. If you are coming from far away for a dream vacation to the USA or the Boston area, you should probably stay somewhere fancier. There are plenty of great hotels in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “If your looking for a hotel that won't break the bank”
Reviews.Author: Richy_m_99
Reviews.Content: I came across the Midtown entirely by accident while looking for a place to just chill for a week away from work. I would normally go to New York, but this year, anything below $150 a night for a single room, and you start noticing words like mice, roaches and "in desperate need of cleaning". So I looked a bit further afield and came up with this gem. They are certainly not words that you are ever likely to find in any review of this hotel. Sure, it doesn't look flashy, especially against the high rise Hilton and Sheriton across the road, but it's clean, comfortable, friendly and in a location that makes the life of a tourist very easy. Oh, did I mention it's also very cheap! Thanks to one of their special offers, I paid only $400 for six nights for single occupancy of a double room which was massive compared to some hotel rooms I've paid a lot more for. As well as being fairly large, the room I had was clean, plenty of storage space, with a well supplied bathroom with plenty of hot water (but it takes about a minute to come through so let it run before climbing in the shower). The beds were comfortable enough even for someone like me who rarely sleeps well in a strange bed. The only disappointing thing was the lack of tea making facilities. They do provide a coffee percolator but no way of simply boiling hot water. Some of the reviews on here have criticised the customer service at the hotel, but I have to say that they couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. Finding somewhere to eat wasn't a problem either. I didn't use the cafe attached to the hotel, mainly because of the limited menu and the fact that nobody else seemed to use it. For breakfast, I can recommend Thorntons diner about 100 yards up towards the Prudential Centre, and in the evening you've got the whole of Boston to choose from thanks to the MBTA (the "T" as it's known locally) station (Symphony or Prudential on the Green "E" line) being on the doorstep with a direct link into the heart of the city. The proximity to the tram line was a godsend, as it meant that I didn't have to plan for a whole day out and carry everything I needed. I could go out and do some shopping in the morning, slip back to the hotel lunchtime, and be back in the City in 30 minutes to do some sight-seeing in the afternoon. It's also cheap to get around on the T, a 7 day visitors pass costing $35 which is good for the trams, subway buses and some local commuter rail journeys. As a first time visitor to Bostom, I was well impressed, enough that I will no doubt return and would have no hesitation in going back to the Midtown. It had everything that I wanted to make a holiday comfortable and enjoyable. I probably wouldn't have gained any more benefit if I had stayed at the Sheriton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Midtown”
Reviews.Author: commscholar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not fancy. But it is clean and sufficient. You can get amazing deals on the place, making it one of the best deals in the heart of Boston. If you're planning on seeing the Boston sites and not spending a lot of time in your room, this place is perfect, and less than a block from Metro stops. If, however, you want to spend a lot of time in your room and want to hang out at the hotel, this is probably not the best place. It does have a pool, but it's not fancy. It has a restaurant, but it's mostly sandwiches and pizz. This was fine with me, since I could afford this restaurant, but almost never eat in fancy restaurants at hotels. I thought the place was perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SSB79
Reviews.Content: The Midtown is located in a great place, easily accessible by Subway and within walking distance of a lot of places and much cheaper than the hotels around it. The staff was extremely helpful during my stay and I found the rooms to be clean and spacious. Not the best looking or fanciest of hotels but certainly good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pearsons
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay very much.Clean and comfortable.Great location,especially for walking in Boston.Front desk v.helpful.Good breakfast at Thorntons,just a few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Most Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: johnnw
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent, great value low-rise hotel that was a total pleasure to stay at. Staff could have not been more helpful. To be picky, the location wasn't great for evening dining options (unless you're under 25), and water in the bathroom could have been warmer, but overall this is super value, close to the T and very comfortable (and a great breakfast diner two minutes away, between the hotel and Prudential).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, very Helpful Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. The front desk staff went out of their way to be helpful to us. The rooms were fine. Good deal and GREAT location.

Reviews.Title: “No problems at all”
Reviews.Author: Frostycat
Reviews.Content: We tend not to stay in 4/5 star hotels in cities, because we never spend much time in our room, so we chose this hotel because it was very well positioned, and cheap. We were not disappointed. OK if you want luxury, this ain't it, but the room was huge, clean and absolutely fine. There is no restaurant (just an adjoining cafe) but with Copley Square and the Prudential Center just a 2-minute walk away (literally) who cares? We found a different place for breakfast every day and you can walk everywhere from this hotel, although if you don't want to, the Beantown Trolley Tours stop right outside, and there are two subway stops within a very short walk. What's to complain about? If you want luxury, pay luxury prices, but if you want a good-value city hotel in an unrivalled position, you can't go wrong with the Midtown. No problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancy14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Midtown Hotel from August 27 until August 31. We had a large, clean room. We had a really nice time, also we were close to all the atrractions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We, a couple from Germany, stayed at the Midtown hotel for four nights and really enjoyed it. We had a big room which was very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The price was perfectly low - compared to other hotels in Boston. And not to forget the good location... It's just a few minutes walk to Prudential Center and Copley Place. We can really recommend this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: The Midtown Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 220 Huntington Avenue, Boston, MA 02115
